Posted: December 23, 2014
												I play this game since it was out and can't stop playing it, after all those years. Multiplayer is all the money.Gameplay: 8/10. Great controls and you can customize them us you like. Shooting hordes of zombies like crazy.Bill: "We can take the subway tunnels to the hospital. There's a Red Line station not far from here."Louis: "Sounds good."Zoey: "Well, I guess we're going to the hospital."Francis: "That's better than my plan."Bill: "What was that?"Francis: "I didn't have one."Graphics: 7/10. They are old but they still do their job.Francis: "Have a heart, we got a helpless old man with us!"Bill: "Close your mouth and open your eyes, Francis. You'll aim better."Sound/Music: 8/10. Adds to the tence. Try to shoot a blipping car if you want to learn how.Francis: "I hate birds."Zoey: "Yeah. Birds are dicκs."Story: 7/10. There is a virus that turned human kind into zombies. Don't ask how it started, don't ask how it will end. You watch The Walking Dead series for 7 years already and you still don't know either of those, how do you expect to learn them from a game!Francis: "Hey, Zoey-when I drive us outta here, don't SHOOT me, alright?"Zoey: "The pilot was a zombie, Francis!"Replay Value: 10/10. Well, did I mention that multiplayer is all the money? You will play a little on Single Player mode to learn it but it gets boring very fast. Just find one of the many servers and play with the still big amount of players who can't stop playing this game!Francis: "Man, Zoey is pi$sed."Louis: "I'm pi$sed too!"Francis: "Really? This is you pi$sed?"Bill: "Y'know, Francis, we'd all think you were a lot smarter if you said less."Overall: 8/10. One of my favourite games of all time, if not ΤΗΕ favourite!Francis: "I got a goddam Witch on my @ss! RUN!"

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 9, 2011
												If you're familiar with Left 4 Dead 2, this is basically the same game but streamlined. For the uninitiated, Left 4 Dead is a multiplayer FPS where four survivors must work together to survive a zombie apocalypse, fighting hordes of fast-moving Common infected and Special infected with unique abilities.In this original iteration, only the Hunter (fast pouncer), Smoker (long-range snarer), Boomer (kamikaze horde summoner), Witch (extremely dangerous if alerted) and Tank (it is what it sounds like) appear.There are four modes in L4D: Campaign (play through one of a number of 'campaigns' in the story), Versus (like Campaign but additional people can control the Special infected), Survival (the hardest mode, where you must hold out for as long as possible against the Infected and set time records), and singleplayer (Campaign with bots on your computer).The gameplay is directed by an AI system named The Director, who spawns items & enemies, and changes the level depending on the status of the survivors. The harder the difficulty, the more contempt it has for you.The presentation, as befitting most Valve games, is stellar. The campaigns are presented as movies, with 'credits' after the end displaying gameplay stats and a separate music Director controlling the incidental music. It does a good job of creating a zombie-film like atmosphere.Only thing of concern is the community. It's not abysmal, but it's relatively small and you'll run into some toxic players, given how cooperative and intense this game can be. If you want to play Expert at all, be prepared to do some janky metagame stuff to fit in - killing players who are below 50 health when they reach the safehouse so they respawn at 50 being one example.Now you might be wondering: with all of the official L4D campaigns ported over to the sequel, why should I play this? Well, there are a number of differences that for make L4D unique and worth playing for me and others even today, and even if it lacks Workshop mod support.Regarding weaponry and equipment:* The weapon animations are simply better than the sequel's. Fortunately, there are mods that port some of them to L4D2. There is also an HD port mod for the pump shotgun.* The pistols are M1911s, which I much prefer over the L4D2 pistols. There is also also an HD port mod for them.* There are less guns, which means more meaningful weaponry choices. Tier one only has the pump shotgun and Uzi; tier two has the auto shotgun, M16 and hunting rifle. The shotguns function the most different: if you reload them from an empty magazine you must rack the chamber before firing. This makes a difference on the harder difficulties.* The melee in non-versus games does not suffer from fatigue; you can keep doing it as long as you need. This is helpful when there are no melee weapons to choose from!* There are only pipe bombs and Molotov cocktails; and no adrenaline shots, defibrillators or ammo packs. Which, again, can make for more of a challenge.Regarding your enemies:* Less Special infected (no Jockey, Charger or Spitter) make for a different and some say harder experience, not in the least because the SI that remain are more dangerous here.* The Common infected appear different and more true to what Valve had in mind.Regarding performance:* The game runs better than L4D2.* The HUD is streamlined and looks better.Regarding aesthetics and other stuff like that:* There are different achievements in L4D; for example you do not get achievements in L4D2 for beating the original campaigns on Expert. If you want credit for doing so, you'll want to do it here.* The little touch to the bot AI's weapon selection is missing in the L4D2 ports. In L4D2, Zoey uses assault rifles as well as hunting rifles, Louis uses shotguns, and Francis uses snipers. This is in contrast to their behaviour in L4D, where Louis would use the Uzi/M16, Francis uses shotguns, and Zoey would usually pick up the hunting rifle.* L4D2's campaigns and aesthetics are action-horror oriented. L4D's are more horror-oriented. While this is largely carried over in the L4D2 ports of the original campaigns, the optimal experience is playing them in L4D.* For those who enjoy glitches, there are a number in the original campaigns that have not been fixed. The Jesus Rock in Death Toll's finale is a prime example.* You can see your legs when you look down.Basically, Left 4 Dead distills the formula to its essence and consequently makes this first entry into the series a classic. I suppose this right here is why it's still being played in a nutshell.Not to say that Left 4 Dead 2 isn't bad, because apart from the weapon animations and its larger but more toxic community it's really not worse - just different. If you want a different Left 4 Dead experience, or you want to ease your way into the franchise by picking it up at the source, I'd recommend this.

Left 4 Dead 2 will never be as good or as better as the original.It's strange how Valve can advertise the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of a game, then completely forget about it a few years later.The game isn't strong and popular as it used to be, but it still holds a strong position in my heart.9/10

content:
Posted: March 30, 2015
												Left4Dead 1:Release Date: November 17, 2008Strengths:-Originality-Good graphics-Extermely good level design and gameplay-No delays, instant action-Great replayability because of random generation of zombies each time-Great story and characters-Good sound and voice acting-Sense of survival is awsome when all your teammates are dead and you are left aloneLimitations:-Low number of weapons-Limited DLC and mapsConclusion:L4D1 is truely revolutionary and a masterpiece game that rightly earned it numerous awards by various game reviewers including "game of the year". What I like about this game is its originality, detailed and thoughtful level design, good story and characters (My favourites Bill>Zoey>Francis>Louis), nice music, sound and voice acting. Still better than Left4Dead 2 in my opinion.  Highly Recommended.Level Design: 10/10Music and Sound: 9/10Gameplay: 10/10Story: 10/10Graphics: 9/10Replayability: 9/10My rating is 9.5.-High2k

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 15
												Left 4 Dead! Ah, a classic fun 4 player Co-Op survival horror game. This game is probably the best most fun game Valve has ever created (besides Half-Life). You choose between a set of four characters: Zoey, Bill, Francis, and Louis. There are different gamemodes such as Single Player Campaign, Co-Op Campaign, Versus, and if you're feeling lucky, Realism Versus and Realism Campaign. Realism is pretty much no hud, you can't see the survivors if you are infected in realism versus, in Campaign you can't see where Meds are, weapons, ect. It's pretty much for those hardcore gamers out there who say "I'm highly skilled in the arm of killing." Now, Let's talk about all that comes with this game.Single Player/Co-Op Campaign: Left 4 Dead expands on six campaigns. No Mercy, Crash Course (Free DLC) , Death Toll, Dead Air, Dam It (Originally Cut) , Blood Harvest, and the most depressing DLC that is now free to play (depressing in a good way) The Sacrifice. No Mercy, Death Toll, Dead Air, and Dam It are all five leveled campaigns while Crash Course is two levels and The Sacrifice is three levels. Each level has a finale where you have to fight on hoards of infected and special infected such as Smokers, Hunters, Boomers, Witches, and of course the biggest baddest infected, The Tank. No! Not a military Tank! It's more like a special infected that took way too many steroids and is buff as f**k. Boomers puke on you or blow up on you if someone shoots him (looking at you Francis) and draws hoards of infected onto whoever has the green goop on them. The Smoker has a very long tounge that grabs you and either strangles you, or if he's close enough he claws at you. Hunters basically pounce on you and claw the hell out of you where someone would consider it♥♥♥♥♥♥ Witches are pretty easy to get by, but if you shine a flashlight at them or shoot at them, or ever startle them, RUN LIKE F**KING HELL!!! Verses: Four survivors Vs. tons of special infected players. There are two rounds per level on a single campaign. One round you will be a survivor where you fight off other players and infected while round two You will be the special infected and hunt down the survivors. Whoever has the most points once a campaign is finished wins.The Verdic: Left 4 Dead is a fun Co-Op/ Single Player survival horror game that you can play for hours and hours. It's a classic and is still amazing and fun to this day to not just me, but the gaming community. In fact, once you get the hang of this one buy Left 4 Dead 2 for even more fun with new special infected, new campaigns, new survivors, and more. My final verdict for Left 4 Dead is a solid 10/10. Now that Left 4 Dead is over 10 years old and it has been a little over 9 years since Left 4 Dead 2 released, I think it's about time for Valve to release Left 4 Dead 3 this year.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
												Good game engine, often feeling like a multiplayerversion of Half-Life, but 3 times better. Broad support for modding and addons, and plenty of those to be found on the web. Good fluent shooter gameplay with some dynamic stuff i.e.: items and pick-ups placed randomly (still at pre-defined locations though). Few glitches and a good overall stability. The game content is  mostly gore not horror, nothing really scary in there just disgusting.Sadly the gaming community is the worst of all i encountered in any multiplayer game. There are players to have a good game with that is roughly 20-30% of the average gamer population for this. The rest of them are egomanic loners who love to waste your gaming experience by either rushing, sabotaging, or even outright teamkilling you. The former are the most frequent type, making you wonder why they even bother playing this with others when they would be much better off playing the game single player. Often you will find they set up fake accounts to "troll" those who simply wish to enjoy an imersive campaign and play with a good team. (Votekick usually wont work, so just let them rush and wait until they get incapped and killed by a special infected or tank, then they usually leave because you did not save their royal butt.)So, if you get this either have 4 or more friends you will be playing it with or be prepared to play this singleplayer more frequently than multiplayer. On a bright side the entire game can be finished in singleplayer and AI is okay as well, just a bit stupid-ish.

content:
Posted: January 9, 2015
												This review is from a single player perspective and if it were from a coop perspective my score would probably be higher.This game is very fun to play:- You get to kill a lot of zombies - always a benefit.- There are  few unique zombies and 2 of them can be extremely powerful on higher difficulty.- There are few different maps and the game doesn't feel repetitive .- Working on valve source engine.- A very good combat system.- A dark environment - fitting to a zombie game.This game also get a major con that can be annoying from a single player perspective - the bots AI is annoying for some time and they can get you killed and even make you restart the level.In addition the game doesn't get a large variety of weapons and can be too dark sometimes (completely dark rooms with nothing in it, not even zombies).Would recommend this game for both single and coop players but for the coop players you should buy this game with friends because that left 4 dead is dead on the online aspect.My score: 8/10

												This review is from a single player perspective and if it were from a coop perspective my score would probably be higher.This game is very fun to play:- You get to kill a lot of zombies - always a benefit.- There are  few unique zombies and 2 of them can be extremely powerful on higher difficulty.- There are few different maps and the game doesn't feel repetitive .- Working on valve source engine.- A very good combat system.- A dark environment - fitting to a zombie game.This game also get a major con that can be annoying from a single player perspective - the bots AI is annoying for some time and they can get you killed and even make you restart the level.In addition the game doesn't get a large variety of weapons and can be too dark sometimes (completely dark rooms with nothing in it, not even zombies).Would recommend this game for both single and coop players but for the coop players you should buy this game with friends because that left 4 dead is dead on the online aspect.My score: 8/10

content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
												Good game engine, often feeling like a multiplayerversion of Half-Life, but 3 times better. Broad support for modding and addons, and plenty of those to be found on the web. Good fluent shooter gameplay with some dynamic stuff i.e.: items and pick-ups placed randomly (still at pre-defined locations though). Few glitches and a good overall stability. The game content is  mostly gore not horror, nothing really scary in there just disgusting.Sadly the gaming community is the worst of all i encountered in any multiplayer game. There are players to have a good game with that is roughly 20-30% of the average gamer population for this. The rest of them are egomanic loners who love to waste your gaming experience by either rushing, sabotaging, or even outright teamkilling you. The former are the most frequent type, making you wonder why they even bother playing this with others when they would be much better off playing the game single player. Often you will find they set up fake accounts to "troll" those who simply wish to enjoy an imersive campaign and play with a good team. (Votekick usually wont work, so just let them rush and wait until they get incapped and killed by a special infected or tank, then they usually leave because you did not save their royal butt.)So, if you get this either have 4 or more friends you will be playing it with or be prepared to play this singleplayer more frequently than multiplayer. On a bright side the entire game can be finished in singleplayer and AI is okay as well, just a bit stupid-ish.

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2012
												Nothing else than a masterpiece, but what else to expect from VALVe? Left 4 Dead was the flagship of the zombie apocalypse genre. With a fairly interesting story-line, as interesting as it can get when zombies are trying to eat you. The game is split up into episodes, or movies, where the four protagonists make their way through all imaginable zombie infested areas.I think Left 4 Dead didn't start the zombie culture, as there were books much earlier, but the game obviously did a great part of magnifying the genre, not only for games but for movies and TV-shows as well. The game has a lot of gore and darkness flowing through it, and I remember being terrified in my first play-through of the game. Looking back - this game didn't have a long lifetime, not as it's "competitor" Killing Floor, that is still kicking.Valve kind of screwed Left 4 Dead over with Left 4 Dead 2 being released only a year after the original. The sequel wasn't even close to having the same atmosphere as it's predecessor, with all that darkness and grain film filter. Valve later ported over the whole Left 4 Dead into the sequel, which gives no reason to play the first game at all, which is very saddening, indeed.

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 6, 2016
												Left 4 Dead is in one word, fun. Its my favorite zombie game, but that doesnt mean theres not flaws...... because there are. For example your kills will be stolen very easily when playing online with people, this can become very frustrating. Another flaw is other players can shoot you and it will take health points away, i guess its for realism but its hard to take that seriously when your hanging on a cliff for an hour waiting for someone to revive you. Also storywise theres not too much to offer, grinding through countless maps with little variety can get kind of boring, but every cloud  has a silver lining. One of those silver linings is the exhilarating moments, the ones where your rescue arrives and hundreds of zombies start chasing after you, its a race for your life and if you do its upsetting but can actually be quite funny with you and your group. To sum this up Left 4 Dead can be played by pretty much anyone, its a fun experience especially with friends and i would certainley recommend it. 7/10would get thrown off a cliff by a tank again

content:
Posted: October 22, 2015
												IMPORTANT!!! This is not a bad game by any means. It is, in fact, a very good game. It's just that Left 4 Dead 2 has everything this game offers AND a whole lot more. If you are looking to get a Left 4 Dead game, just get Left 4 Dead 2. I suppose you could get this game and Left 4 Dead 2 for the sake of bragging rights, but that's really about it. The only reason I have this game in my library is because I preordered Evolve, which, as I said in my Left 4 Dead 2 review, is probably one of the biggest financial mistakes I've made in my life to date.UPDATE:Looking at people's reactions to this review, I'm a little unsure whether I should keep this review up to encourage discussion or if I should go ahead and give Left 4 Dead 1 the old thumbs up so people don't get so butthurt.Also I am a wondering if people were mislead by my "biggest financial mistake in my life to date" ramble. Evolve was what I was dissing, not Left 4 Dead 1. And I'm not gonna go comdemning people who have purchased Left 4 Dead 1 even if I didn't like it, because how you spend your money is none of my business.Look, I'm not gonna go lying about how I feel about this game. Yes, there are enough differences between the two games for them to technically pass as two separate games. The differences just aren't substantial enough for me to justify trying to sell this game as being infinitely better like the entire planet seems to think it is. I will not deny that Left 4 Dead 1 is an absolute masterpiece. I will not deny that there were plenty of changes made from L4D1 to L4D2 that were most certainly NOT for the better (most notably, IMHO, the ridiculous camera movement when being damaged). But I am BAFFLED by the fact that people compare these games like they have zero similarities to each other, completely ignoring the fact that both games are built on the EXACT same engine, have the EXACT same base gameplay mechanics, and even use many of the EXACT same in-game assets.It's not like I'm never going to play this game. I will absolutely pick this game up on occasion and play for a while. Like I said, I don't think the game is bad at all. I've even gone so far as to make a point (which EVERYONE has made a point of missing) that it is, in fact, a fantastic game. But the lack of any truly substantial game-changing tweak from L4D1 to L4D2 on top of the fact that L4D2 has more characters, more guns, more campaigns, Steam Workshop integration, better zombie gore, even melee weapons... I'm sorry, the appeal of zombie games to me is the killing of the zombies in itself, and L4D2 provides more options in that respect than L4D1. While I absolutely understand that many other people have many other reasons to play zombie games besides the zombie killing in itself (such as atmosphere, story, horror, etc.), the fact that L4D2 delivers better on the sheer joy of murdering zombies than L4D1 is exactly that. You know, a fact. And at the end of the day, why else are we even playing any Left 4 Dead game? The atmosphere? Maybe. The story? Meh. The horror? You've gotta be kidding me.But seriously. If you think you have something to tell me that you think will change my opinion, please let me know. And no, whining about how you are so insulted by my review will not accomplish anything. If anything, it would probably be worth noting that the L4D1 community consists mostly of butthurt children who would rather be antagonized by any critical statement in regards to their precious little game, instead of freaking the ♥♥♥♥ out about the fact that right-winged Adolf Hitler 2.0 is running for president of the United States. You know, like any halfway decent excuse for a human being would.Good day. :)

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												TL;DR at the bottomWow. Coming from a guy who spent a lot of time playing Left 4 Dead 2, I can personally say this game is actually really awesome. Some people simply don't play this game, because everything that's in this game is in Left 4 Dead 2. Which is true to a degree, however there are some differences. First of all, there are only Left 4 Dead campaigns (which is obviously expected). Second of all, There are no melee weapons either. Third of all, the community is almost dead.Ok so why the hell would I recommend this game? Well, it feels like a better game. Let me explain. Valve wanted to create an amazing 4 player co-op zombie survival game and they did! It was pretty damn scary, it had great characters, the tone of the game was really dark, and it was a ton of fun! On top of that you could actually see your own legs! Left 4 Dead 2 just feels like an upgrade of the game by adding new campaigns, characters, and melee weapons. Left 4 Dead never got the attention it deserved (in my opinion) because Valve decided to release L4D2 way earlier than it was supposed to be released.hat I'm trying to say is, Left 4 Dead feels more like a classic Valve game and feels like a simple game compared to Left 4 Dead 2. Left 4 Dead 2 is a great game, but Left 4 Dead is simply a classic.TL;DRLeft 4 Dead is a great FPS game created by Valve that's taken place in the Zombie apocalypse. It's an amazing 4 player co-op game that anyone can enjoy! If you're still not satisfied of what this game has to offer, go buy L4D2.Overall rating 9/10

content:
Posted: March 9, 2011
												I love Left 4 Dead. The atmosphere, the visuals, the pacing, the humor, the maps.Valve reinvented co-operative gameplay with this title. Sure, there have been multiplayer games that let you mash bad guys as a group, but never done as thoroughly as L4D does it. Your team's survival depends on teamwork. And yet, it's never complicated. L4D rewards you for behaving exactly as you should behave if there really was a zombie apocalypse. Stay together as a group, watch each other's back. Share resources.The Versus mode exemplifies these themes too, in that the infected team works best if the individuals cooperate and coordinate. All of this adds up to an awesome "beer & pretzels" alternative to your usual hardcore fare.L4D2 one-ups L4D in many ways, but the atmosphere of the original is much darker. When Valve adapts all L4D maps for L4D2, there will be little reason left to buy this game... but still. It's on sale all the time. Enjoy a little piece of history.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 11, 2016
												Very great game, tactical co-op at it's finest. L4D2 has everything this game has to offer and much more, all the campaigns from this game are remastered and get this, some layouts of the maps are changed to provide more challenge. So not everything is the same.AI acts very differently in this game. The survivor bots AI is laughable, mediocre, you put some nasty word here. Let me elaborate. Bots in this game are so advanced they can commit friendly fire, yes, it's possible, and you thought bots from the 2nd game were bad. Comparing bots from this game to bots from the second is like comparing the 1st computer ever made to a highly advanced computer of today's modern age. Yeah, they're that bad. They will never be around you, they will rather focus on a zombie that's too far away and circle around him than to provide cover for you. When you get incapped by a special infected it will take them ages to find you and free you, especially on the higher difficulties.Like the survivor AI, the infected AI is here, but, that AI is slightly, shall we say, improved. You remember that strategy for the tank, igniting him with a molotov and then running and gunning? Well, it won't work anymore, in this game, setting a tank on fire will boost his speed making him a force to be reckoned with on expert. Capable of obliterating the entire team in seconds. Which of course will make you think of the new strats to take on him. Hunters, smokers and boomers, they all come in the most unfortunate moments, like when you're incapped, or you're in the middle of a horde attack. They tend to spawn out of mid air too, see, you're, let's say in this alley right now, you turn a corner to pick up pills, you turn around and there they are, even though, they weren't there in the 1st place. Another shi*storm sent there by AI Director.Lots and lots of abusable glitches in this game, for survival, for campaigns, you name it. Note that all these glitches present are good glitches which can help you if you learn how to exploit them. No bad glitches so far.You know your general setup of guns, other gear, and campaigns. Campaigns are beautifully crafted, level design are out of this world, how well made are they. Each time you play, the game will be different than the last one you played each time providing a challenge. Thanks to the AI Director which controlls all the item and infected spawns in those campaigns.Also, apart from the 2nd installment, you can carry more ammunition for some guns, mostly starting shotgun and tactical/combat shotgun. Now, after all I've said, let's move onto the community. This game has at least 200-600 people playing daily, you'll find maybe 2-3 campaigns on which you can join from the selection menu, maybe 1 or none versus game, and here and there a couple of survival games. Community is small, not a lot of people are playing this game anymore because the sequel is superior in most ways. Even though the community is small, you'll still find griefers(trolls), so some form of cancer is still present in this game. Versus community is as toxic as that of the 2nd game. One mistake and you're gone. So stay away till you know you can handle yourself. You'll meet a couple of really nice people here and there, my advice, friend them, and stick close to them. Best way to play this game is to play with friends, isolate yourself from the griefers and just enjoy and have a blast.One last thing for you gun fans out there, there are no workshop add-ons in this game, workshop for this game is non existant. So, just a heads up. This game is purely old school.Now, after all I've said, you can either take my words for it, or go and try it yourself, you decide if you want this game or not.With every bad thing this game has, I love it with all my heart. Played it back in the day on x360, and bought it here for nostalgia sake only to find it on brink of it's death. Still it's pretty fun with the right crowd.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 20, 2015
												This game is an absolute gem, a must-have for any Left 4 Dead fans out there.The first Left 4 Dead game I've ever played was Left 4 Dead 2. The only time I've played the original (this one) was with my cousins but it was only for a measly 30 minutes or so, I can't vividly remember.Coming from a person who has technically never played this original masterpiece, I can confirm that this♥♥♥♥♥♥is better than Left 4 Dead 2 in many factors. The game's atmosphere is much darker than L4D2 (Like It's supposed to be). The Common Infected sound so much better, same with the special infected. There are also small soundtracks that you may not have heard in the sequel, you can find one of them at the last level of No Mercy after you beat the first tank.All in all; for it's price right now @ Summer Sales (or any sales out there really), buy this ♥♥♥♥ing game if you're a true L4D fan. It's worth the money.

content:
Posted: October 24, 2011
												There's an answer of great playing if you don't pretend your own mirror to the others.Well, the first sentence is about general behaviour when playing. What about my overall recommendation of Left 4 Dead? Let's remind some convenient facts about the game:1. Left 4 Dead and all its software was not created to judge players or annoy people by amoral playing. Although we have our own rules and expectations, we should not pretend bad or unpleasant habits, that may be gain from another players or from our personal skills.2. Left 4 Dead is a co-op game and the players should help each other in their team, no matter the level they are. Feeling of completed competition or game is very appreciated and everybody can do. Realize its right intention and have a good experience of playing.3. Left 4 Dead was a game made for everyone, so it means that even 18- people can buy it and play it. What I'm not satisfied with - almost every person under 18, or let me say - a child, doesn't know all the useful tactics or hasn't learned them yet. I recommend team-playing.4. Left 4 Dead should be a competitive game, and it really is. Although, the players are not so competitive, or they don't think properly when playing. This is the main reason for mistakes and unpleasant fails. But to have a fun is also not so bad.5. And the last important thing to write about is, my closest, making a progress in game by yourself. Well, having your achievements done day by day is good, but the biggest award is given by playing itself. As the days went on, I felt myself stronger and happier.Don't forget to enjoy your game, no matter which one it is...Thank you for reading.Pro 'Yester(Matúš)

content:
Posted: March 19, 2014
												I'm only recommending this if you have played L4D2 already, if you haven't played/bought that, please buy L4D2 rather than L4D1 since they cost the same amount anyway.Anyway, ever since when the campaigns from L4D1 got ported to L4D2, this game got more and more less played. For a reason, it's more enjoyable though to play a single game as a party with campaigns from two games, rather than always switch between 2 games if you want to play different campaigns.Campaigns itself and the whole scenario in L4D1 are better though, probably they aren't really that much different from what they are in L4D2 though to some people, so in case if you don't already see any difference between them yourself, you should just stick to the sequel.The versus game on this one has more idea than in L4D2, since on L4D2 you just run to the safe room and that's it, with this you all have to maintain your health as good too rather than crawl to the safe room as a group.Still, with that there's the one problem you would notice if you have played both games, there's half of the special infected that you can use in versus since there are more added zombies in the sequel. It's kind of like a preference if you don't like Chargers, Jockeys or Spitters, but I would find 2 Hunters, Smokers or Boomers a bit unfair altogether.There are some things that you might miss from L4D2, like special weapons or throwables, or even some of the gamemodes. Making mostly only the Campaigns the core of this game, which it mostly is though of course. I don't think you would be able to get more than 4 people to get to play this in these days anyway now.This is still a great game though, but I don't see any reason to spend money on this for the story, since as said, all the same campaigns are already in L4D2. There's even more story between The Sacrifice and The Passing than almost at any other part of the game and those both campaigns were added to L4D2 in the first place too.Only thing that this has what L4D2 doesn't, is a one survival map. So if you're dying to get that, feel free to spend 20€ to get that rather than to search a custom map file for it somewhere for L4D2.

Posted: March 4, 2016
												Left 4 DeadNo mundo devastado acompanhámos quatro sobreviventes que escapam a uma epidemia mundial. Bill, Francis, Louis e Zoey tentam garantir a sua sobrevivência a todo custo.Vamos percorrer ruas infestadas por zumbies e outras criaturas que aguardam por ti na escuridão desde Witchess que atormentam os nosso pesadelos, Smokers com uma língua gigante que arrasta as sua vítimas deixado totalmente mobilizadas,Hunter são rápidos e ágeis tem ataque mortífero em longa distância mobilizando as suas vitimas, Boomer um gordo com pessimo hálito que vomita sobre nós atraindo uma “manada” de zombies, por último Tank tem um força incrível que arrasta tudo o que tiver a sua frente.No modo Campanha é possível jogar sozinho (Offline) ou co-op Multiplayer assim como outros modo Versus aonde podes controlar as criaturas contra os sobreviventes no modo Survival é aguentar o mais tempo possivel contra um exército infinito de zumbis.Good★★★What about this one? Run? Don't run? What?Run! Definitely run!

												Well,let me review this great game.Is from 2008,which i like older games.There is 4 protagonists that they need to survive a zombie apocalypse.Bill:An old man which was in military.Francis:A biker.Louis:A polite and positive man which was worked in a IT programs before the zombie apocalypse.Zoey:A 18-19 years old women which she was in a university,which at her home she has seeing how his parents become zombies but she was saved by Bill.Dramatic soundtrack which shows that the game is sad.Versus:In this mode you can play first as Survivor or an Special Infected.(I prefer to play with my friends instead of random players)Survival:Frsutation on this mode,seriousily.Campagin:You can play with bots or with friends.Achievements:Is hardly most of achievements with bots or random players only,i require to get with friends.Difficulty:If you are a begginer to zombie games i recommended to play on easy or normal difficulty.If you know zombies games very well you can try Advanced and Expert.On Expert i can say the nickname of mode:Hell difficulty because a normal zombie can deal 10-20 damage per hit and you can die very easy,mostly if a horde is on your way.And Special Infected,yes you heard Special Infected which they can put you down in 5 seconds if you are not careful.Smoker:A guy that smokes a lot before he was zombie and like to drag Bill mostly.Boomer:A guy that was eating a lot before the apocalypse and he can vomit on you,Euchhh.Hunter:A guy which was a parkour guy before the apocalypse and he likes to pounce Zoey mostly and he is boyfriend with the Witch.Tank:He is Chuck Norris zombie version.Witch:She cries,a LOT,she can kill you very easy on Expert mode.NOTE:Some of the words was a jockey,uh i mean joke.I wish this is more played because it was simply unfair,after the release in 8-9 months was released L4D2,i dont have problem with the sequel but is unfair in my opinion.Final note:9/10

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 2, 2011
												Left 4 Dead will be forever in my heart. It is such a shame that this game didn't get so much attention as counter strike for example. I have edited this review because the old one didn't describe the game much. So here we go...Left 4 Dead is a zombie themed cooperative, multiplayer game. It has its faults/bugs, but its just because Valve did not pay much attention to it aaaand it also has few game modes:- survival, campaign, versusIf there were some new players coming (which is highly unlikely), id say: "have fun, go to campaign mode, try out survival and play some versus. All of these are best played using ... no not an xbox controller :D ... your friends! Campaign is just something you are going to walkthrough and never play again. I used to play it with my friends for races (whoever gets 1st to safehouse gets points etc...) Survival is great if you are the type of player who's looking for challange or wants to break some kind of records. It might be totally boring for many many players around...The main thing what makes Left 4 Dead the ultimate and unforgetable game to me, is the versus mode. Spent many hours playing and the only regret is that I did not get into this game earlier when the player base was bigger (I dont even think there is one nowdays).4v4 co-op, 4 survivors vs 4 special zombies, its not only about how good you are at shooting zombies, its about cooperation as survivors as well as the zombies and tactics... Yeah okay not while playing public games haha.But the thing I wanted to say is, that this game had so BIG potential for a competitive scene! But I think its too much for Valve to run Counter Strike and something else next to it.score: 10/10old review here:If you like teamplay, cooperation with others, action and zombies, you will totally love this game. It will be maybe difficult to get used to it and to learn things... but if you're going to listen to more experienced players, there is a huge chance that you'll discover the secret of this game... best coop ever... trust me

content:
Posted: February 21
												Don't let my small time listed here mean anything. I've mainly played it through the Left 4 Dead 2 interface. That being said, if you are an achievement hunter, don't do that. The achievements don't unlock for this game if you play it that way. When this game came out in 2008 it was a breathe of fresh air. A Co-op zombie FPS for a genre that really didn't have many Co-op games at the time. While I'm not a fan of FPS that don't offer ADS, this was a really challening game, especially on the harder levels. Randomly spraying and praying could get you booted out of a game because hitting your teammates could kill them. Another breathe of fresh air from other FPS where you generally could not harm your teammates gave this game a bit of realism. And since I'm posting this review in 2017 you may ask why bother buying this game now, well because of the extensive modding community and the fact that the graphics still stand up well today almost 10 years later. If you have a group of friends and want a game you can play with each other every week, this is a great game to choose. I highly recommend.

Posted: March 19, 2011
												"Thier coming to get you Barbara." (Johnny in Night Of the living Dead)"You call this a Zombie Apocalypse? This ain't nothin' comparied the Zombie Attacks of 1954." (Bill in L4D)"Z O M B I E S  man, they creep me out." (Dennis Hopper in Land Of The Dead)Yes, what more is able to creep one out than ZOMBIES! If you can settle yourself, grab a shotgun, say "Groovy" and run into a horde of zombies. Then Left 4 Dead is the game for you!Not only are there zombies by the hundreds. But also laughs by the same amount! Team up with 3 other friends and the fun increases!The graphics are top notch and still hold brains above other zombie games of today.Random generation of zombies will keep the game fresh and on your toes.L4D not only includes your run-of-the-mill zombie. There is a witch zombie, Smoker zombie, Hunter zombie, Boomer zombie and the dreaded Tank zombie. (When you hear the Tank zombie music, you'll find yourself holding back panic. It really is that intense.)***** :D

content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
												I highly recommend this game to fans of co-op games. Even though Left 4 Dead 2 is technically better, the original still manages to be a pretty awesome game in it's own terms. The game is split up into a bunch of campaigns, each split into five chapters/levels (excluding two campaigns). The first four levels require a team of characters to progress to a safe house. Along the way, you encounter or are attacked/ambushed by hundreds of zombies, and while they are pretty to defeat, the sheer number of attacking enemies can be overwhelming. Teamwork is a key element when playing on normal difficulty or over. Adding to the enemies are a number of minibosses, which require different strategies to defeat. Some are pretty easy, while others keep you on your toes. The fifth and final level/chapter in the campaign is normally some kind of extraction from the area, which requires players to defend themsevles in a certain area for a set amount of time. It can get pretty intense.There are four characters to choose from before the start of the campaigns. There's a computer guy, a biker, a war veteran, and a college girl. There's not much of a difference with who you choose, it's more of a personal preferance. But even so, there's quite a bit of dialouge for each character, some for scripted events in the campaigns, and a ton of comments/quotes for player use during gameplay. This is useful for players who don't have a microphone during multiplayer. Speaking of multiplayer, there's an interesting versus mode, where some players play as the survivors, while the others take control of the game's minibosses. And not to mention a survival mode.The graphics are pretty good. Even though this game is from 2009, it still holds up in today's standards. Lighting and flashlight mechanics are impressive. Textures are mostly high quality. Depending on your rig, the game maintains a good-maximum framerate, even when you have thirty zombies running around in your field of vision. I was surprised that the game ran so well, since I have a pretty bad graphics card for gaming. I managed to put almost all settings to max. On the negative side, I see black spots like a radius around fire ingame, although I'm sure it's just my graphics card (Intel 3000 integrated).All in all, I think this a great game. I myself play mainly solo, but this is certainly best played coopertatively. Worth the money. 9/10.

content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
												Well, I'll get right to it.This game is the best one of the two games in the series as of right now.Things it has that L4D2 does not:+ambiance+mood+color scheme+animations+hunter mechanics - bhopping the hunter, rooftop access in almost all areas, etc.+minimal hud elementsAll of these go together to make L4D1 a much more 'crisp' feeling environment.Things about the game I don't like:  (Bear in mind not many of these are the game's fault - and most of these issues fall right on Valve)- Lack of support from the developers, as it seems mainly, to pun, "left for dead" in sake of the sequel by Valve. I mean the game doesn't even have trading cards and early access titles on steam that are purchasable Alpha-stage games DO. What's that say? - Also, no steam workshop.- There are a number of exploits in the first game that are left totally unchecked by the default game developers - such as crouch glitching a hunter in versus off of a collision-enabled object such as a moveable car [punchable]. (too many to list here)- No competitive mode ever instated in the game: I.E. a rebalancing mode that would work much like the Rotoblin sourcemod plugin - removing tier 2 weaponry or limiting them, as well as items and health items.- No SOURCETV or HLTV equivalent!!!- Extremely locked-down engine, with SO many commands being set to literally "DEVONLY" tags in the source code itself - making them invisible inside the engine without removing the "DEVONLY" tags or using Sourcemod.- No easy or simple way to remove all of the elements of the hud visually [Ilncluding visual recoil] during demo recording, for good smooths, for stable recording that feels more 'camera-like', as POV demos can be somewhat messy, and a cleaning up is always in order when cfging, and you must write a config to record them smoothly, ((and while this is nice of them as a company to let us use the developer console, this is the best kind of game in that arena, and Valve has always held steadfast to that for their older games)); meant solely to increase the popularity of their games that much more.  :/ Come on its a glorification for a fan to dedicate some of their time on earth to the personal creation of something like that, and when done right they are very entertaining.

The achievements don't unlock for this game if you play it that way. When this game came out in 2008 it was a breathe of fresh air. A Co-op zombie FPS for a genre that really didn't have many Co-op games at the time. While I'm not a fan of FPS that don't offer ADS, this was a really challening game, especially on the harder levels. Randomly spraying and praying could get you booted out of a game because hitting your teammates could kill them. Another breathe of fresh air from other FPS where you generally could not harm your teammates gave this game a bit of realism. And since I'm posting this review in 2017 you may ask why bother buying this game now, well because of the extensive modding community and the fact that the graphics still stand up well today almost 10 years later. If you have a group of friends and want a game you can play with each other every week, this is a great game to choose. I highly recommend.

If you can settle yourself, grab a shotgun, say "Groovy" and run into a horde of zombies. Then Left 4 Dead is the game for you!Not only are there zombies by the hundreds. But also laughs by the same amount! Team up with 3 other friends and the fun increases!The graphics are top notch and still hold brains above other zombie games of today.Random generation of zombies will keep the game fresh and on your toes.L4D not only includes your run-of-the-mill zombie. There is a witch zombie, Smoker zombie, Hunter zombie, Boomer zombie and the dreaded Tank zombie. (When you hear the Tank zombie music, you'll find yourself holding back panic. It really is that intense.)***** :D

content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
GameplayThe gameplay is absolutely flawless in this game! Everything is very smooth; and since the game uses a thing they call the "AI Director" each time you play a map the enemies will be in different locations. Making it enjoyable for a long time! I've been playing this game since 2009 when it came out and I have yet to be bored of this game unlike the second one.Player BaseThere aren't much people playing this game anymore sadly, since everyone has moved to L4D2. But the people who do have this game are usually very fun to play with. You do have your "occasional" child gamer or troll, but other than that most players are mature and fun to play with as stated before. Versus is usually dead while Survival and Campaigns usually always have at least a few servers joinable.ModsSince this IS a Valve game, mod support is here, it's a bit tricky but once you get the hang of it it's very easy. So no, unless you use an actual hack you can't get banned for using a mod on here. There's a few annoying modded servers on here as well. I find them annoying but I get some people would find them enjoyable, who knows?StoryThere isn't much of a story since Valve messed up the game when they acquired it from Turtle Rock (the original creators of L4D which people call the "beta"). But the jokes of the survivors and great voice acting make up for it somewhat.ConclusionOverall if you're looking to kill some zombies, have a few laughs, and have a good time with friends; I HIGHLY recommend this game. If you want a bit more, like more guns, special infected, and gamemodes than try out L4D2. Me personality, I don't really care much for L4D2. But back to L4D1, the survivors are lovable, the special infected are great and not annoying (unlike L4D2, and the maps are very fun. Besides the fact that there's a whole bunch of custom maps you can download from the internet. So yes, I highly recommend this game and give it a solid; 9.5/10

content:
Posted: April 1
												Left 4 Dead.  What can I say?  I'm finally atoning for past sins by FINALLY PURCHASING THIS GAME ON STEAM.  I've put countless hours into this game before buying it so don't mistake my mere number of hours logged on Steam for lack of time playing.  If you enjoy killing hordes of zombies that were once people with kids, families, wives, husbands, bakers, bankers, lawyers (I mean come on now, what kind of zombie would a lawyer be without ACTUALLY being a zombie?), this game is definitely for you.  Even for being about 10 years old this game is still a treat to play.Pros:+ The game has aged surprisingly well in the past 10 years.  Like wine, this game gets better with age+ graphically still pleasing on the eyes+ HORDES OF ZOMBIES+ "The director", an internal AI piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥that sends an♥♥♥♥♥ton of zombies at you if it deems you haven't been in trouble for awhile+ Running gags in-game that each chapter of the campaign is its own little movie+ Is a little terrifying when you don't know what's going to happen+ co-op is always a plus and it comes from the days when LAN was still a thing+ surprises around every corner+ Teamwork is truly a thing in this game but remember it's not Killing Floor or KF2Cons:- for people who enoy ADS in their FPS games, there isn't any.  It's like UNLOVED in that aspect (personally I don't mind this)- the graphics HAVE AGED a little but they're not BAD, and in fact are still good (so not so much of a con)- the modest selection of weapons is a little bland but it's not a dealbreaker (pistols/dual wield pistols, shotgun, M16/M4, .22 hunting rifle)2008/2008: would play  10 year old game for hours on end to kill hordes of the undead.

content:
Posted: April 8, 2013
												Прикольный кооперативный зомби шутер. В центре внимания 4 главных героя, которые "по счастливой случайности" :) не успели на эвакуационный вертолёт, в итоге им приходится пробиватся через толпы зомби численность которых достигает от 1000 до 3000 особей. Каждая новая компания, это начало после конца предедущей, ведь по сюжету главные герои так и не могут эвакуироваться (всегда им что-то мешает), и приходится искать новую точку эвакуации. В игре имеется командная работа, особенно когда эти 4 человека живые люди, а также настоящее выживание, требующие сплочённость команды если играть на очень высокой сложности.Оценка: Великолепно 10/10

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 31, 2013
												Can I get better recommendation to any game that I've played it 3764 times, spend in game more than 2600 hpurs in nearly three years?And this is only some basic facts that  cannot adequate describe my in-game feelings. Many times I've asked myself whati in this game is so adoictivelly immersive, that I've to spent so much time, allthough I posses more than 100 verg good games'Finally I can say that L4D is grounded on the deeply humanistic orientated and composed game I've ever personally meet. Even if you play it single, there are so good (and funny) dialogues that feel some kind of deeply socialised partnership. Actually, after few trials you somehow know that you are usual member of the "apocalypticcy survibal crew" . Additionally, every NPC has own style, personality, and recognizable value system, belief and precipously portretet character. NPC-s are never boring, you'll not noticed any kind of fepetitioning sequence, even if I recognized appropriate sentence, because it is usually happened in a kind of new situation.Also, this game is somehow react on your way of playing, so sonmetimes you'll find a lot of unexpectzed situation - as you usuali have on higher level. In my opinion this is very good, because on that way game cannot become a kind of boring content.I warmly  recommend L4D to any gamer (not only to FPS lover, 'cause I'm personally NOT FPS lover...)), In my opinion, L4D1 is bacsed on deeply humanisticly oriented game, warm stoy of usual humans, who give us a hope, even that things go worse. Aččthough it seems to be uncorrest - but legitimate - previously written L4D1 recomendation CANNOT be used as a concept of L4D2 RECOMENDATION, but rather as very opposite. Just say onestly: L4D2  is deeply missing tragic atempt, basic on idea that something what is actuaslly perfect, can be renewed to be "more" perfect?

The Start of a Great Zombie Shooter SeriesThe game has turned a concept that has been done over time and time again, that is moving from section to section killing dozens of zombies, into endless hours of fun. The use of teamwork in this game is critical as the zombies come at you at what seems to be lightning speeds in the heat of moments. This game is definitely one to get for all zombie shooter fans. I would have to say the thrills of other well known zombie games such as the Call of Duty zombie modes....NotesAll the content that is in this version of Left 4 Dead is available in "Left 4 Dead 2"

content:
Posted: July 24, 2013
												At start, some things about Left 4 Dead.L4D is an awesome game, epic gameplay, graphic, playable characters which are nice, and most important thing - It's a game about zombies !. Yes, i love games with zombies and apocaliptic climate in background. It is a game for everyone who like zombies - Killing like and playing as them. U have 4 playable main characters, which u choose ? It's your decision !. On Versus mode u can play as zombies. U have 5 zombie "Bosses" which 4 are playable. 3 are random everyime and 1 - Called Tank - choosed for any player in infected team. All is random.Then now i choose good and bad atributes of L4D.Good Sites:+Great climate.+Best Multiplayer Mode focused on teamplay.+Two sites in Multi.+ZOMBIES !.+Some effective weapons.+AI are good.+Play with friends !.+Much Campaigns, u can download more if u want.Bad Sites:-Not much weapons.-Some bugs.-Not open world. U just have to go from 1 point to 2nd point...-Valve forgot about it some time ago, and do not want make any patches / Bux fixes for it anymore.I look on hours played too. I have around 4,500 so it's great game -for me- and i will stay with her for long time. I hope L4D never die.9,5/10

												Time and time again, I can always go back and have a good time either by myself or with friends. Understandably frightening and scary for some given the theme and spooky level designs, it is always amusing for me. Left 4 Dead established the norm for zombie shooter games and really made something special. It is the kind of game that can leave you with some great memories, especially if you play with friends. I know I still reminice with my friends of some of the great games we played together. A staple game to be part of any PC gamer's collection.

												A game which puts you in a fast paced zombie apocalypse, where teamwork is essential and mindless actions often result in tragic consequences. This game is a timeless classic and probably the best example of how a co-op shooter should work.  As a team you are really dependent on your team to progress forward  –  this is extremely true in Versus mode in which botched planning or a disorganized team can result in death. But when it all does go all wrong it’s a hell of a laugh and in the end that’s what this game is, it’s you trying to survive a zombie apocalypse with your somewhat incompetent friends helping you.  Definitely worth playing and should be on any person’s steam list

content:
Posted: November 2, 2011
												Classic "can't put down." If I'm going to recommend why you should play Left 4 Dead, I have to convince you right here, right now why it is better than Left 4 Dead 2. I'll do that by making comparisons.Left 4 Dead is the nostalgic zombie game of the twenty-first century.Mod friendly and complete capability for customization of game play.There's an ambiance in the original L4D which you can not find in the first.I've had 700 hours of gameplay in both games and I can tell you the AI director is different in both games.  Let us say the AI director in Left 4 Dead is GOD. In Left 4 Dead 2, the AI director is GORDON RAMSAY.Let me say there is nothing wrong with the Introduction of new infected. However, the Jockey and the Charger exaggerate a new issue in L4D2: spawn location. pawning infected in checked rooms, cleared areas, is one thing. However, spawning special infected in a checked room/closet/space right after leaving that space makes no sense. If that is supposed to make the game more challenging, it is a very lazy way of doing so.  Let alone add two new infected that have an extremely fast gap closer, spawning them in the closet you just closed based on a rule of "20 feet" or so is not fun. In Left 4 Dead 1, Spawns for infected started at a distance and because of clever level design, were able to move in and sneak up. Spawning right on top of your location is not clever or sneaky. It is annoying. That is how left 4 Dead 2 works. Wherever you are, the zombies are. The zombies spawn based on your location, instead of being apart of the ambiance.With that said, I will briefly summarize the pro's and cons of each game right here so you can choose what you want for yourself. Keep in mind what I am about to tell you are facts. Writing reviews based on opinion is as pointless.Left 4 Dead Pros: 1. Ambiance2. Pace (Zombie spawning)3. Difficulty4. Streamlined (complete game)5. Mod Friendly6. Can see your own feet.7. Easy hosting and server set upCons:1. Need for new infected role (Spitter, NOT charger or jockey)2. Need for new Gameplay Mechanics and guns (Adrenaline, grenade launcher)3. Community player base demolished since release of sequel.Left 4 Dead 2 Pros:1. Great Versus Mode2. Very Mod Friendly3. New Infected Roles change game dynamics4. Large Community Playerbase5. New, exciting game modes6. More jokesCons:1. Horrible AI spawns and game pacing2. Lack of Ambiance3. Sometime too difficult because of bad spawning4. Can't see your own feet5. Difficult server set up, local servers limited6. Large number of unusual behaviors by zombies coined as "random, planned."

content:
Posted: December 6, 2012
												Left 4 Dead is a spectacular first person cooperative shooter, and it's largely given rise to the massive coop and party game focused generation we have right now. Before Left 4 Dead the only major coop exclusive games were mods like Sven Co-OpHowever, as much as I liked Left 4 Dead it was an imperfect game that was only improved upon gradually through patches and DLC. One of the features that makes Left 4 Dead and it's successor interesting is the AI Director. Valve must have realized Left 4 Dead would be exclusively a rental unless they spiced things up to the player. What the AI Director does is decide where zombies and items in the world are depending on the player's progress and how well they work together. Every time you play the game it is completely different, especially depending on who you play with.The biggest factor to buying Left 4 Dead is wether or not to purchase the second instead. I believe the campaigns from L4D1 have already been ported to L4D2. As a result Left 4 Dead remains just a curious bit of history and only a purchase if your not a big fan of Valve's big budget changes with L4D2.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20, 2015
												Left 4 Dead offers the best zombie fighting experience I've had gaming and with great play functionality allowing gamers from all walks of life to start playing without experience. The more casual gamers may sadly get tired of the repetitiveness that zombie killing produces even with several campaigns on offer. Online multiplayer does however offer fun extras to the game as does the variety of zombies included in the storymode. And who doesn't love a great zombie slayer game?8/10Pros/Cons+ A good variety of zombies (provided by the "specials") and the multiplayer mode mixes up gameplay.+ The decent graphics and well integrated audio make for a well-rounded gaming experience.+ Killing zombies  is a hugely fun novelty compared to most of the modern FPS games of today.+ Smooth game mechanics with a brilliant pick-up and play style make this an excellent game for all. - There is no doubt a lack of content given that this game relies on replaying the campaigns.- Even the different campaigns get slightly repetitive as you play them through for the first time.

content:
Posted: January 20, 2014
												This is another game that I have played hundreds if not thousands of hours on, I played them on Xbox so I was glad I got the chance to play some Left 4 Dead again on pc this time. All the stuff you love is there, the co-op the zombies, the survival, the versus, and now that I am playing on pc, there are mods! Sadly something else also remains the same, votekick abuse. It is a real issue I assure you, there are far to many random kicks, but I will say this. Can you imagine how bad things would be without it? Either way its great to see the game again after so many years of playing. One thing I can say for certain is that it was a good port for xbox, its a great pc game, one of the best co-op games and an amazing addition to your library.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 11, 2015
												Left 4 Dead is a zombie-themed cooperative (or competive) team FPS made by Valve and Turtle Rock Studios, released in 2008 for PC. You play as one of the four survivors who have to get from point A to point B, while defending themselves from hordes of 'fast' zombies and search corners for supplies. Or you can play as special infected too, in more competive mode. Don't mind "Game of the Year Edition" over the banner, it's just there for coolness, not some complete edition. It did have three "free DLC" / big updates that added survival mode, Crash Cource and Sacrifice campaign since it came out.Multiplayer community is still quiet alive, even though most moved over to Left 4 Dead 2. You will not always find exactly what you want, but you will still find some people playing the game. Aside from Survival mode, that part is empty, everybody was overrun by zombies it seems.And well, it's a pretty great game. It got great setting, with a great atmosphere of always being set at night. With four likable characters. Simple yet deep gameplay. It is simple compared to L4D2, you don't have much choice, variations, in weapons for example. Feels more refined too. Somehow I dig it more. It even has two grenade types, which are actually useful and tactical in this horde based game.The best thing about it is AI Director. In other words, it's a system that keeps track of players "stress level" and then would change position of items, zombies and other small changes. It's quiet clever in that it both serves as randomizer and also follows general rules of pacing. No, it's quite predictable. Moment of rushing zombies and wandering zombies change around, when it gets quiet that it means that something heavy is coming or that you barely survived previous challenge. And that it doesn't spawn zombies so good, so in Versus modes people just rush forward.And while it's predictable, the different pacing still makes it much more addictive. The question is not what, but how soon and when.But there is one thing which would make it hard to decide if to recommend it or not. All the campaigns ended up being included in L4D2! Not only that, but they were expanded with all the new stuff that L4D2 added. Weapons, special infected types. Not only that, but if you want more original experience, then you can run the mutator that limits content back to L4D1. Though it's a bit uneven. But still.The only different things would be nitpick, like some slight level alternation, or not being able to see your body when moving camera down, or if you hate watching flying gibs from explosion for some reason.And well, most people should just purchase L4D2 instead, as it has all that L4D1 got. The first one still has it's own appeal, to be honest, in small changes. Very small differences. But eh, leave it to purists of sorts. Otherwise, if you are core gamer of sorts, then buy it, It's awesome game by itself.

content:
Posted: July 21, 2015
												Left 4 Dead is a 4-player co-op survival FPS set in a world full of infected that crave your flesh.You play as either Zoey, Bill, Francis, or Louis (depending on who you choose to play as) and with your friends (online) orNPCs (if being played offline) along with you on your side, plowing through hordes of the infected whilst trying to reach the safehouse. The final level of each chapter has you escaping in a vehicle of some sort. Each chapter usually contains 4 levels. The game contains 9 chapters.  This is how the main game mode is played.But besides killing common, there exist other dreaded creatures....The special infected! Unlike the common infected, these guys have their own unique abilities. The Smoker, a tall slender infected with a long tongue that's ready to grab you!The Boomer, a bloated ball of puss, ready to puke on you! Which attracts a horde of infected, so don't get too close!The Hunter, a hooded covert that pounces and mercilessly claws through your flesh! You'll know when he's near, once you hear his dreaded growl.The Witch, a sobbing woman that gets enraged when you get to close! Keep your distance, or else she'll shear you into pieces!And the worst of all.... The Tank!A giant mass of muscle and speed, ready to smack you to Timbuk2! Killing him usually requires a group effort!But besides killing infected until you reach the safehouse, other fun modes exist! Other game modes, such as Infected, has you either play on a team of survivors or special infected, all being controlled by live players, duking it out until one team has been completely wiped out. Survival mode is a horde mode where you and others fight through countless waves of infected, the goal is to survive as long as you possibly can! This is an online game mode as well, but it's possible to play this one offline. Even though this game was released 6 1/2 years ago, it holds up extremely well! This is a title that you shouldn't pass up on!

A Really nice game that you can play alone or with friends / family / homeless / Your Pets.I am happy to Recommend this game that i been playing for over 7.0 years now as of 03-07-2017.I'm at 2,543Hrs on record as of 03-07-2017 and i still love it.Left for dead 1 / Left for dead 2 are not better than each other what it comes down too is what one you love more because of that , I recommend you buy both and see which one you Truely will love and you should spend at least 1K+ hours in Each before you Judge them(at least 250+ hours in single player mode & 500+ hours in VS Mode & 250+ Hours in Others) You should spend these hours in-game with friends not just idle it / playing with bad teammates.You will learn that in the end both games are great to play with others , with that said its a good idea to make some good friends to play with and join them when playing both games.what i learn after playing this for over 7 yearsThe Tank gets mad because the group farted in his food and messed with him why he is with his girlfriend but in the end the group remembers the tank just Wants a Hug.The Hunter wants Zoey because she mooned him because they both enjoyed it.The smoker wants bill for his beard & smoking habit because he loves it.The Boomer wants Francis because  the boomer wants his coat so he can sell it on ebay to buy stuff to help him lose weight.The witch wants Louis but he rejects her for being a cry baby about his flaming farting in bed

content:
Posted: March 17
												 When it comes to the question "Which is better? L4D or L4D2?" I will say every single time Left 4 Dead is better. The game looks better, it plays and feels better. It's also harder than L4D2 and has some gameplay features that is not in L4D2 that makes it harder. For example, Tanks that are on fire in L4D become much faster and can completely murder you're entire team, where as in L4D2, there is no increase in speed. It is of my own opinion also that I think L4D2 just feels more like an arcade game where you can just rush through the campagin. No challenge, not hard at all unless you're playing a modded map that is solely created TO be hard as it possibly can. Now if you looked at how many hours I have on L4D2 and think I am a hypocrite, then I ask you to stop right there and pull the head that is yours out of you're♥♥♥♥♥ I've quit L4D2 many times because of how sick I've gotten of the player base(trolls and teamkillers) but I've gone back because of the mods. I know people buy L4D2 over L4D because it has all of the maps, characters and special infected and weapons and other content, but then they're introduced to the world of L4D2s literal ♥♥♥♥ing hive of teamkillers and trolls. Yes there are griefers in L4D1 but not NEARLY as much as there is in L4D2. So to the question of "Which is better? L4D or L4D2?" Left 4 Dead is the answer, it'll always be the answer.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 1, 2013
												Watch out for the Incredible Purple Hulk (you’ll see what I mean!)Play L4D at your peril! This game is completely addictive – at least it is for me. Shooting zombies is just so much fun, especially when it’s made possible by such a well-crafted game. The premise is very simple: you and three fellow survivors have to make your way from one safe house to another until you are finally rescued. Along the way you have to fight off hordes of slavering zombies. In single player mode the AI is pretty good, although your teammates don’t always behave as you might wish them to during the incredibly hectic campaign finales. There are 4 campaigns with 5 maps to each one. Replay value is good due to the fact that the AI changes the zombie attacks and spawn points with each play, so you never know where the horde is going to come flooding from or where the bosses are lurking. When you get bored with the maps supplied there are loads of 3rd party maps and campaigns available on the web. On top of all this you can even play as one the various types of zombies (on a random basis). Personally I find this less satisfying, but it is worth a go just to get the other perspective. This is a simple but truly great game. L4D2 here I come!5/5

content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
												I bought this game as part of the Summer sale (yeah, I know, a million years after everyone else.) my only previous experience with it was a friend brought it over on the Xbox once, I didn't do too well then either. Upon buying it, perhaps unwisely I jumped straight into a multiplayer campaign, to my (pleasent) surprise, I had a blast, the controls are well designed to the point where a tutorial is almost completely unnecessary, the atmosphere is extremely effective (to the point that whenever I was firing an assault rifle for any length of time I found myself almost involuntarily screaming "SUPPRESSING FIIIIRE!" until I was done or out of ammo. and the great thing about getting into this game late is, lots of people still play it, odds are you will end up on a team with far more experienced people, and as long as you can avoid accidentally shooting them (six times on the first level) you won't feel like you're slowing them down and, hopefully you'll get into the swing of things as I did and feel a valuable member of the team before the campaign is over.All in all, very fun game, there is definitely a reason that this still costs more than some other, more recent shooters I've seen

content:
Posted: October 31, 2011
												Left 4 Dead is an amazing game. I am a lover of all things Valve, and a sucker for games that make you feel epic in every aspect possible, and this game delievered exactly these things. My interest in buying this game came from the Steam Halloween sales...I knew not much about it except for a pretty cool trailer I saw for it, and was also considering Killing Floor. I got both, and gotta say I love L4D over twice as much. I've never really played a multiplayer co-op before but this just took me by the balls and made them produce a cournucopia of ♥♥♥♥ due to the amazing factor. It brings together players easily and in very cool ways. CONSIDERING L4D2 OVER THIS?? Grab this one. The characters are so much more fun imo, and I think the hype of new weapons is unnecessary, as I have never felt a shortage or care of weapon diversity. And melee weapons are cool but more of an extra, and will kill you if you buy a game for that! Also L4D is very populated!! (My first impressions in comments)

												I remember playing Left 4 Dead on the 360 with my friends, and I'm glad I got back to the game again on PC. I can say that the experience is much fun on PC. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2011
												A game which puts you in a fast paced zombie apocalypse, where teamwork is essential and mindless actions often result in tragic consequences. This game is a timeless classic and probably the best example of how a co-op shooter should work.  As a team you are really dependent on your team to progress forward  –  this is extremely true in Versus mode in which botched planning or a disorganized team can result in death. But when it all does go all wrong it’s a hell of a laugh and in the end that’s what this game is, it’s you trying to survive a zombie apocalypse with your somewhat incompetent friends helping you.  Definitely worth playing and should be on any person’s steam list

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 17
												 When it comes to the question "Which is better? L4D or L4D2?" I will say every single time Left 4 Dead is better. The game looks better, it plays and feels better. It's also harder than L4D2 and has some gameplay features that is not in L4D2 that makes it harder. For example, Tanks that are on fire in L4D become much faster and can completely murder you're entire team, where as in L4D2, there is no increase in speed. It is of my own opinion also that I think L4D2 just feels more like an arcade game where you can just rush through the campagin. No challenge, not hard at all unless you're playing a modded map that is solely created TO be hard as it possibly can. Now if you looked at how many hours I have on L4D2 and think I am a hypocrite, then I ask you to stop right there and pull the head that is yours out of you're♥♥♥♥♥ I've quit L4D2 many times because of how sick I've gotten of the player base(trolls and teamkillers) but I've gone back because of the mods. I know people buy L4D2 over L4D because it has all of the maps, characters and special infected and weapons and other content, but then they're introduced to the world of L4D2s literal ♥♥♥♥ing hive of teamkillers and trolls. Yes there are griefers in L4D1 but not NEARLY as much as there is in L4D2. So to the question of "Which is better? L4D or L4D2?" Left 4 Dead is the answer, it'll always be the answer.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 11, 2016
												It's hard to recommend a primarily coop game that has such a small community, but I still give it a buy.You should still be able to find a game most of the time, there just is little selection in what game mode, difficulty, etc. due to the small player base. Personally, I prefer this to its successor, and perhaps that's just nostalgia from the days playing this on my 360 and having a blast with my friends. I do think the game has excellent campaigns and the atmosphere when you hear the music pick up and you know the horde is coming you get such an adrenaline rush that is rarely matched in video games.Pick it up if you can snag it on sale, it's well worth the sales price.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 24, 2014
												For all fans of the zombie apocalypse this is worth more than a try.It's worth having.A variety of enemies (some are not really zombies per se but super enhanced mutations like the tank and the hunter)to fight against and die from.But at least you're not alone, misery loves company and there are four of you fighting and dying together.AI controlled buddies do a good job covering your♥♥♥♥♥and healing you.They are smart most of the time at least, but without them you don't survive for very long.Life in this game is a struggle or a fight to get from one safehouse to another, in a genuinelycreepy atmosphere.The graphics in this game really gives a good definition to the word "Desolation".Going thru deserted streets and buildings that remind you of a war torn scenario really adds to the game's flavor.The scenes are a work of art.Weapons and ammo are plentiful in supply so you don't have to go far being defenseless.This game is a good lesson in teamwork because without it you're dead in this apocalypticuniverse.This world is not for the rugged individualist.If you are the loner type then go to Dead Island but if you want to rely on others for yoursurvival then this is the place.The world of LFD.
