												Here's a little story, one day I was just sitting down casually playing Left 4 Dead until I got into a lobby that had 2 elitists and 1 noob. 10 minutes into the gameplay, I accidently shot one of my teamates(one of the elitist) and I apologized for shooting him. In return, he kills me and spawn traps me continuously until he died. The level restarted and I brought it upon myself to get revenge. I killed him and both him and his butt buddy decided to kick me just for simply getting revenge. If you ever run into these type of people just report them and leave. Overall the game is pretty darn good. The community is "eh" it has good sports that don't get mad just because you accidently shoot them, and bad sports that get mad just because you accidently shot them once. I rate this game 8/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20, 2015
												Left 4 Dead offers the best zombie fighting experience I've had gaming and with great play functionality allowing gamers from all walks of life to start playing without experience. The more casual gamers may sadly get tired of the repetitiveness that zombie killing produces even with several campaigns on offer. Online multiplayer does however offer fun extras to the game as does the variety of zombies included in the storymode. And who doesn't love a great zombie slayer game?8/10Pros/Cons+ A good variety of zombies (provided by the "specials") and the multiplayer mode mixes up gameplay.+ The decent graphics and well integrated audio make for a well-rounded gaming experience.+ Killing zombies  is a hugely fun novelty compared to most of the modern FPS games of today.+ Smooth game mechanics with a brilliant pick-up and play style make this an excellent game for all. - There is no doubt a lack of content given that this game relies on replaying the campaigns.- Even the different campaigns get slightly repetitive as you play them through for the first time.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2012
												If you ever needed a game that combined friendly voice chat and blood curdling zombies it will always be Left 4 Dead and Left 4 Dead 2.Left 4 Dead is a scientific marvel of what combines co-operative play with survival: If you are a Zombie fan and you like Zombie games but do not own this game... prepare to be shamed cos this game has probably beaten anything that game threw at you to try and "scare" you.  Sometimes you can be in total silence, nearing the safe room door. Not a zombie in sight, sweat glacing down your forehead: all you team-mates are down you're on your own and getting closer and closer and suddenly "AAAAAARRRRRHHHH!" and you pace yourself two steps back because a hunter just jumped on you.The game features an eerie soundtrack that can sometimes be laughable at times, it's a game you can sit down with and have a good laugh with anyone in your friends list (if they don't own the game there's bound to be someone still playing it to this very day).I love this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 1, 2011
												Arguably the best FPS for its year.  L4D is one of those games that punishes you if you try to be a lone wolf and go out by yourself. In fact, one of the many strengths of this game is that you live or die by your team and the weakest teammate can even be a liability (because you're always saving them or they're not covering their corners or they're using all the team healing resources up). No matter how good you are at this game you can still get capped by a Special (i.e. something tougher than a zombie) and the only way to be saved is by one of your teammates. Additionally, it's almost impossible to do the finales by yourself (especially on any difficulties above normal) so, again, I like that the team is vital to the success of the mission. Weapon selections are tiered as you progress through the campaigns (which vary in length from half an hour to many hours, especially if you die and keep repeating chapters) and there are nice goodies to help you against the zombie hordes such as Molotov Cocktails, pipe bombs, gas cans, propane tanks, oxygen tanks but none of these matter much if you don't follow one of the cardinal rules of positioning yourself strategically. This is a game that also rewards you for positioning your team in the most strategic positions when you are attacked by random zombie hordes or at various chapter finales. In fact, if you aren't very good at protecting your teammates and putting your back to a solid wall when the hordes come, well, you probably shouldn't be playing on advanced difficulty and certainly not the unforgiving expert level. Healing resources are limited to health packs and pills and in the higher difficulties there's never enough. In fact, sometimes it makes sense to let a few teammates die so that the others can make it to the safe house chapter where everyone who died spawns for the next chapter. That way, you don't all have to die and repeat the chapter. If someone died soon enough in a particular chapter they respawn in one of the many closets up ahead but a teammate has to "rescue" you. Spawned characters start at moderate health and lose some of their resources, especially a favorite main weapon.But the real pleasure of this game is the multiplayer. In fact, if you don't MP your gaming experience may dwindle after a time. Yes, it's true that the director of this game changes elements even if you play the same campaign over and over with the bots but the dynamics of playing with real people and not just bots throws in so many variables. Weaker players will make the campaign harder and sometimes that can be fun. Stronger players will make it easier and they'll also show you tricks that you're unlikely to read in the cheat books. In fact, chances are good that you'll start to have favorites that you like to play with regularly and as you get to know your particular team better you will react better to them when they need help. Compare that to when you play with new people for the first time, even if you all have microphones for faster communication.  Other nice things about MP (at least, on Steam which is my experience) is that you can do different types of coop scenarios that fans have created.  They're free to download.  If you're tired of the same maps this can be a lot of fun.  Additionally, if you want something different they have survival games in which a group holds out for as long as possible but the real attraction, if you want something different, is the versus games. Each side takes turns playing the Specials and try to stop the other team from reaching the safe house. Victory points are all determined by how far the survivors have gotten, how much damage was inflicted on them, whether health packs were used or not and several other variables. Interestingly, people who are very good at coop games are usually not very good at versus games as its a totally different beast.SOME OF THE BAD/CRITICISMS: the AI, compared to L4D2, is sometimes slow to respond.  They don't always save you in time when they should and they won't always help you defend at unique positions during chapter finales; some argue a lack of melee weapons is a problem but I think it's not an issue and just makes it a different type of strategy game. In MP you can get some real low quality people showing up in the public rooms but a nice thing is that a majority of people in agreement can kick the bad player out of the game. Worse case scenario you just leave and look for another game.In closing this is an awesome game for FPS fans, especially if you want an action horror video game. Unlike a lot of other video games the achievements are unique and sometimes entertaining. A nice thing about them is that you get to show them off to your friends on Steam. These days I typically look to whether a particular player has achieved the expert status achievement.  If they have then I know they're likely going to be a tight player.BTW, playing this on Steam and other multiplayer sites make this a lot harder than your Xbox. A couple of friends who played it on the Xbox jumped on to Steam with me and couldn't even handle normal difficulty until they practiced some. Just a fair warning.MUSIC/SOUND:  A minus ; EASE OF CONTROLS/USES:  A minus to A  ; GRAPHICS FOR ITS YEAR: A;  DIALOGUE/VOICE ACTING/CHARACTERS: B to B plus (even though it's limited as to be expected for a FPS); ATMOSPHERE: A to A plus; REPLAY POTENTIAL Ato A plus (on MP);  GENRE: Horror Action Adventure; OVERALL GRADE: A minus to A.

												It's hard to recommend a primarily coop game that has such a small community, but I still give it a buy.You should still be able to find a game most of the time, there just is little selection in what game mode, difficulty, etc. due to the small player base. Personally, I prefer this to its successor, and perhaps that's just nostalgia from the days playing this on my 360 and having a blast with my friends. I do think the game has excellent campaigns and the atmosphere when you hear the music pick up and you know the horde is coming you get such an adrenaline rush that is rarely matched in video games.Pick it up if you can snag it on sale, it's well worth the sales price.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 24, 2014
												For all fans of the zombie apocalypse this is worth more than a try.It's worth having.A variety of enemies (some are not really zombies per se but super enhanced mutations like the tank and the hunter)to fight against and die from.But at least you're not alone, misery loves company and there are four of you fighting and dying together.AI controlled buddies do a good job covering your♥♥♥♥♥and healing you.They are smart most of the time at least, but without them you don't survive for very long.Life in this game is a struggle or a fight to get from one safehouse to another, in a genuinelycreepy atmosphere.The graphics in this game really gives a good definition to the word "Desolation".Going thru deserted streets and buildings that remind you of a war torn scenario really adds to the game's flavor.The scenes are a work of art.Weapons and ammo are plentiful in supply so you don't have to go far being defenseless.This game is a good lesson in teamwork because without it you're dead in this apocalypticuniverse.This world is not for the rugged individualist.If you are the loner type then go to Dead Island but if you want to rely on others for yoursurvival then this is the place.The world of LFD.

												Here's a little story, one day I was just sitting down casually playing Left 4 Dead until I got into a lobby that had 2 elitists and 1 noob. 10 minutes into the gameplay, I accidently shot one of my teamates(one of the elitist) and I apologized for shooting him. In return, he kills me and spawn traps me continuously until he died. The level restarted and I brought it upon myself to get revenge. I killed him and both him and his butt buddy decided to kick me just for simply getting revenge. If you ever run into these type of people just report them and leave. Overall the game is pretty darn good. The community is "eh" it has good sports that don't get mad just because you accidently shoot them, and bad sports that get mad just because you accidently shot them once. I rate this game 8/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2016
												The 2016 Steam Awards made me notice I still have to review the game that made me the gamer I am today. The game that started it all. That started my own personal experience with Steam. Come with me down memory lane, to a time when I only had this game in my library and I thought I was going to forget about Steam the day I was going to stop playing it. How wrong I was! Many games, friends, sleepless nights and gaming hours later I am still here. I cannot forget how this marked the beginning of an era and a personal milestone in virtual zombie bashing. A landmark actually. The first planck of the tree house I built (and keep upgrading) on the Steam tree.But enough with the metaphors already and back to the review! When achievements weren't there and detailed game statistics where yet to come (the gaming hours I have on record for this game are way less than the actual hours I spent playing it!) I had a lot of fun with L4D, becoming quickly addicted to it. It was a breakthrough experience in multiplayer and co-op. It was the game where to make friends and the versus mode is still one of my fav game modes ever.Yes, if you own Left 4 Dead 2 you can basically play all this game has to offer since all the campaigns have been ported over but the lack of Jockeys, Spitters and Chargers in the original game can still give you a different kind of experience. More cozy. So, if you don't have this game yet or if you spent many hours on Left 4 Dead 2 already and think you can pass on this, do yourself a favor and give it a try. Own a piece of Steam history!For me, it still is and it will always be a 10/10 game. Oh, the memories! And it surely has the "Villain Most In Need of A Hug" in it (Hint! Hint!).

content:
Posted: November 28, 2010
												Whether you prefer to beat back the crazed hordes with your friends, total strangers, or AI Bots, there is always something challenging enough to keep you on your toes and continually checking your heart-rate in Left 4 Dead.All the elements of the game - the plot, design, music and of course, the characters' personalities and banter - come together to create a stunningly cinematic experience, and you'll quickly find yourself being drawn into the hellish shambles of the world it has created; even as paranoid as the higher difficulties can make you, it will still find a way to knock you off balance and leave you to get back to your feet before the next onslaught comes down upon you - but never to the extent where you'll be put off the game; indeed, said paranoia serve to draw you into the game even further.Intense, witty, action-packed, and made of handpicked, locally-grown organic Whoop♥♥♥♥♥ I highly recommend L4D.

Posted: March 30
												Overall, I would say this is a pretty solid game, and a great co op experience.But, there are problems. one thing that really sticks out to me is the AI for the other survivors in single player. The AI is so dumb that it makes expert difficulty almost impossible, and its not even that hard otherwise. the AI tend to stand out in the open, barely moving or dodging zombies, just spraying. this may not be a big deal on easier difficulties but it pretty much forces you to play co op if you want to do it on harder difficulties. BUT, no one plays this anymore. you wont find anymore matches. so you need to convince 3 friends to buy and play the game with you. which is a problem for me since... well, i dont have friends.Apart from that, this game is really fun. L4D2 is more fun and has more players, but i personally prefer the characters in this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 3, 2015
												Left4Dead is a badass zombie game which has gotten many things right:+ The 4 characters to choose from effectively map the players preferences+ The choice of weapons forces you to choose a unique approach+ Whereas it's a good game in singelplayer, it shines in multiplayer. Gather a friend or two if you wanna get the most out of it.+ The helping/reviving system was a great idea+ The way the game gets tougher is well balanced+ It's almost an arena-type of game with almost secluded areas where you have to fight off a horde of enemies. Because of that I tried to do it Quake 3 style - constantly moving around and shooting left and right as I go. To my extreme pleasure it didn't work. Why's that a good thing? Because Quake 3 style is not realistic. If you wanna survive, you have to stick close to the other survivors and hold the fort. Every time I went berzerk I got quickly overwhelmed and ran down. + The urban environments look great and vary just enough.+ The arena approach offers good replay value+ I loved the balance between a horror game and an action shooterSome things I would have liked differently:- Only 6 types of zombies throughout the game. - The build up to encountering a Witch is one of the best I've seen in any video game. You can hear the cry from distance, then the frantic piano starts and the NPC's start to comment that there's a Witch somewhere. Such a good build-up for a tough battle, yet once you encounter her and she attacks, it's a short-lived gunfight. I so wished that the battle itself was times harder.- It's still an extremely primitive shooterVerdict:In it's simplicity it's an attractive game that gets the basics right. Because of that a brief but pure amusement is easy to achieve. It seems to be the kind of game that I will come back to every now and then.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 27, 2015
												Forever a must play...(All my own opinions/experiences/joys)As an avid fan of zombie games, I can honestly say this is the one I have enjoyed the most!Once you've got your sensitivity set, you're set to take on the hordes of seemingly endless zombies, alongside your three friends (don't take it personally when they shoot you in the back, they're probably just trying to shoot the zombie that's about to swipe at you). I highly recommend getting up to three other people on board that you can speak to via headset. I say this due to the fact (and you may be surprised how often this occurs) they may not realise that you've been pounced on by a hunter, pulled away by a smoker or thrown up on by a boomer (...thus resulting in being molested by a horde of horny zombies, that want to rip your clothes off) and you will end up typing things like “jyghk!!!11!” in the chat, just to be abandoned, angry, on the ground, bleeding out, shooting wildly into the crowd of gropers around you.So in short, get a headset... (And some friends)After getting into the swing of sticking together and (although you may hate it) helping out your teammates, picking them up when they go down and parting with your precious pills to prolong their lives, you will  become a pro. You'll be running the Expert level campaigns, crowning witches, burning tanks, sniping hunters in the face mid jump, generally winning at the game.Versus is another story... A lot of fun, however it's hard to find a normal server these days, so you'll be thrown into a 20 vs 20 game which is both hilariously fun and rage quittingly frustrating. So again, private games with friends trumps crazy hacker filled custom servers.From playing Left 4 Dead for nights on end on the Xbox 360 with my buddy (MrSneakyMan), listening to Rammstein in order to pump ourselves up to fight the horde, to finally downloading it on PC and pouring even more hours into it. I still keep coming back to this game, sometimes for a quick versus match, other times to replay entire campaigns with the strangers of the internet (yeah, you...).Just buy it... :)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 3, 2015
												Left4Dead is a badass zombie game which has gotten many things right:+ The 4 characters to choose from effectively map the players preferences+ The choice of weapons forces you to choose a unique approach+ Whereas it's a good game in singelplayer, it shines in multiplayer. Gather a friend or two if you wanna get the most out of it.+ The helping/reviving system was a great idea+ The way the game gets tougher is well balanced+ It's almost an arena-type of game with almost secluded areas where you have to fight off a horde of enemies. Because of that I tried to do it Quake 3 style - constantly moving around and shooting left and right as I go. To my extreme pleasure it didn't work. Why's that a good thing? Because Quake 3 style is not realistic. If you wanna survive, you have to stick close to the other survivors and hold the fort. Every time I went berzerk I got quickly overwhelmed and ran down. + The urban environments look great and vary just enough.+ The arena approach offers good replay value+ I loved the balance between a horror game and an action shooterSome things I would have liked differently:- Only 6 types of zombies throughout the game. - The build up to encountering a Witch is one of the best I've seen in any video game. You can hear the cry from distance, then the frantic piano starts and the NPC's start to comment that there's a Witch somewhere. Such a good build-up for a tough battle, yet once you encounter her and she attacks, it's a short-lived gunfight. I so wished that the battle itself was times harder.- It's still an extremely primitive shooterVerdict:In it's simplicity it's an attractive game that gets the basics right. Because of that a brief but pure amusement is easy to achieve. It seems to be the kind of game that I will come back to every now and then.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2015
The original, and still the best game of the series Left for dead is still a great play, and while I liked L4D2 typically I always come back to first. The game really is at it's best with four friends working together. Co-op is at the heart of L4D, and it's greatest strength. What valve really nails is the simplicity of the game. There aren't many controls, items, or weapons. You know all you need to know in 5 minutes. But learning, and dealing with certain situations gets better with practice. The verse mode is great, troll your friends with one of the “special infected” zombies. Each with it's own special ability. L4D does a great job randomizing enemy spawn points, and mobs seem to trigger right when they should. The atmosphere, and music are on point for this type of game. The graphics can be scaled back, and I find you can run this on practically any PC (not your grandmas Windows 95, but anything from 2012 and up should be fine). The only drawback I find in the PC version is the lack of split screen co-op. This can be done with a command from the dev console, but I think valve should have put it in the menu like they did on Xbox 360. Here is a link if you want to play local split screen. http://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?t=745113If you haven't played this one yet and enjoy blasting Zombies with your friends, check it out.OLDER GAMER APPROVEDPOTATO PC CERTIFIED Visit our Currator Page

content:
Posted: March 30
												Overall, I would say this is a pretty solid game, and a great co op experience.But, there are problems. one thing that really sticks out to me is the AI for the other survivors in single player. The AI is so dumb that it makes expert difficulty almost impossible, and its not even that hard otherwise. the AI tend to stand out in the open, barely moving or dodging zombies, just spraying. this may not be a big deal on easier difficulties but it pretty much forces you to play co op if you want to do it on harder difficulties. BUT, no one plays this anymore. you wont find anymore matches. so you need to convince 3 friends to buy and play the game with you. which is a problem for me since... well, i dont have friends.Apart from that, this game is really fun. L4D2 is more fun and has more players, but i personally prefer the characters in this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2016
												The 2016 Steam Awards made me notice I still have to review the game that made me the gamer I am today. The game that started it all. That started my own personal experience with Steam. Come with me down memory lane, to a time when I only had this game in my library and I thought I was going to forget about Steam the day I was going to stop playing it. How wrong I was! Many games, friends, sleepless nights and gaming hours later I am still here. I cannot forget how this marked the beginning of an era and a personal milestone in virtual zombie bashing. A landmark actually. The first planck of the tree house I built (and keep upgrading) on the Steam tree.But enough with the metaphors already and back to the review! When achievements weren't there and detailed game statistics where yet to come (the gaming hours I have on record for this game are way less than the actual hours I spent playing it!) I had a lot of fun with L4D, becoming quickly addicted to it. It was a breakthrough experience in multiplayer and co-op. It was the game where to make friends and the versus mode is still one of my fav game modes ever.Yes, if you own Left 4 Dead 2 you can basically play all this game has to offer since all the campaigns have been ported over but the lack of Jockeys, Spitters and Chargers in the original game can still give you a different kind of experience. More cozy. So, if you don't have this game yet or if you spent many hours on Left 4 Dead 2 already and think you can pass on this, do yourself a favor and give it a try. Own a piece of Steam history!For me, it still is and it will always be a 10/10 game. Oh, the memories! And it surely has the "Villain Most In Need of A Hug" in it (Hint! Hint!).

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 6, 2015
The original, and still the best game of the series Left for dead is still a great play, and while I liked L4D2 typically I always come back to first. The game really is at it's best with four friends working together. Co-op is at the heart of L4D, and it's greatest strength. What valve really nails is the simplicity of the game. There aren't many controls, items, or weapons. You know all you need to know in 5 minutes. But learning, and dealing with certain situations gets better with practice. The verse mode is great, troll your friends with one of the “special infected” zombies. Each with it's own special ability. L4D does a great job randomizing enemy spawn points, and mobs seem to trigger right when they should. The atmosphere, and music are on point for this type of game. The graphics can be scaled back, and I find you can run this on practically any PC (not your grandmas Windows 95, but anything from 2012 and up should be fine). The only drawback I find in the PC version is the lack of split screen co-op. This can be done with a command from the dev console, but I think valve should have put it in the menu like they did on Xbox 360. Here is a link if you want to play local split screen. http://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?t=745113If you haven't played this one yet and enjoy blasting Zombies with your friends, check it out.OLDER GAMER APPROVEDPOTATO PC CERTIFIED Visit our Currator Page

content:
Posted: August 27, 2015
												Forever a must play...(All my own opinions/experiences/joys)As an avid fan of zombie games, I can honestly say this is the one I have enjoyed the most!Once you've got your sensitivity set, you're set to take on the hordes of seemingly endless zombies, alongside your three friends (don't take it personally when they shoot you in the back, they're probably just trying to shoot the zombie that's about to swipe at you). I highly recommend getting up to three other people on board that you can speak to via headset. I say this due to the fact (and you may be surprised how often this occurs) they may not realise that you've been pounced on by a hunter, pulled away by a smoker or thrown up on by a boomer (...thus resulting in being molested by a horde of horny zombies, that want to rip your clothes off) and you will end up typing things like “jyghk!!!11!” in the chat, just to be abandoned, angry, on the ground, bleeding out, shooting wildly into the crowd of gropers around you.So in short, get a headset... (And some friends)After getting into the swing of sticking together and (although you may hate it) helping out your teammates, picking them up when they go down and parting with your precious pills to prolong their lives, you will  become a pro. You'll be running the Expert level campaigns, crowning witches, burning tanks, sniping hunters in the face mid jump, generally winning at the game.Versus is another story... A lot of fun, however it's hard to find a normal server these days, so you'll be thrown into a 20 vs 20 game which is both hilariously fun and rage quittingly frustrating. So again, private games with friends trumps crazy hacker filled custom servers.From playing Left 4 Dead for nights on end on the Xbox 360 with my buddy (MrSneakyMan), listening to Rammstein in order to pump ourselves up to fight the horde, to finally downloading it on PC and pouring even more hours into it. I still keep coming back to this game, sometimes for a quick versus match, other times to replay entire campaigns with the strangers of the internet (yeah, you...).Just buy it... :)

content:
Posted: May 20, 2011
												As I sit here in my palatial library, sipping on a vintage whisky all the while stroking my cat Hermann, I can think of nothing more sophisticated than to recommend this game. Granted, the second one is far more updated and seems to be getting all the love from Valve but forget-ye-not this old little nugget of glory. The sense of the apocalypse and zombie-juiciness as well as the last-humans-on-earth vibe is far stronger and the atmosphere in this is far greater.I concede that the second game has more campaigns, weapons, zombies as well as a better "gore engine" for want of a better word, however these seem to combine with the bible-belt all guns blazing aesthetic to create an action-horror game, rather than an immersive B-movie experience you can throw yourself into. I love the second game a great deal. The coup de grâce I shall deliver is that Left 4 Dead simply has a better atmosphere. No update to Left 4 Dead 2 could change that.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 3, 2014
												I remember the days of playing this on console, trying to find groups of people to do the insanely annoying achievements and to complete expert.One of the best zombie games in existence, this fast and non stop zombie shooter faces you versus untold hordes of infected humans, once alive and like minded, they have succumb to a rage virus, destroying the minds of those infected.You play 1 of 4 survivors, immune to the rage virus for unknown reasons and must survive the thousands of mindless "undead" and the special infected, humans that have undergone odd and dangerous changes to their anatomy based on their past lifes. Many different gametypes and achievements will keep you busy, making you team up with like minded people to complete annoying and tough challenges. For all the achievement hunters out there, they will be a good collection.Solo play is also enjoyable, allowing you to just relax and kill zombies at your own pace.Steam approved sites and other third party websites have skins, maps, sounds and other mods that are perfectly fine and legal to use whenever you feel bored with the original game. Just stay away from the hacks, no one likes a dirty hacker.Personal Rating: 4/5

content:
Posted: November 10, 2014
												Currently still the best co-operative FPS game in existence, in my opinion. It may look a little dated now, but the source engine still feels good to play in, and the game is just hard enough to remain a bit of a challenge unless you are really paying attention. It's a very limited content game, just 5 or so hour-long campaigns for co-op play, but somehow I'm still playing the game occasionally with the same guys 6 years after release. Unlike Borderlands, the guns actually feel like they are doing damage, the panic can be real and you need a decent strategy to beat the campaign finales. Unlike Left 4 Dead 2, it is not entirely random and a good, careful player can sometimes make it through the game with barely a scratch, giving a real sense of achievement.

content:
Posted: May 20, 2011
												As I sit here in my palatial library, sipping on a vintage whisky all the while stroking my cat Hermann, I can think of nothing more sophisticated than to recommend this game. Granted, the second one is far more updated and seems to be getting all the love from Valve but forget-ye-not this old little nugget of glory. The sense of the apocalypse and zombie-juiciness as well as the last-humans-on-earth vibe is far stronger and the atmosphere in this is far greater.I concede that the second game has more campaigns, weapons, zombies as well as a better "gore engine" for want of a better word, however these seem to combine with the bible-belt all guns blazing aesthetic to create an action-horror game, rather than an immersive B-movie experience you can throw yourself into. I love the second game a great deal. The coup de grâce I shall deliver is that Left 4 Dead simply has a better atmosphere. No update to Left 4 Dead 2 could change that.

content:
Posted: March 3, 2014
												I remember the days of playing this on console, trying to find groups of people to do the insanely annoying achievements and to complete expert.One of the best zombie games in existence, this fast and non stop zombie shooter faces you versus untold hordes of infected humans, once alive and like minded, they have succumb to a rage virus, destroying the minds of those infected.You play 1 of 4 survivors, immune to the rage virus for unknown reasons and must survive the thousands of mindless "undead" and the special infected, humans that have undergone odd and dangerous changes to their anatomy based on their past lifes. Many different gametypes and achievements will keep you busy, making you team up with like minded people to complete annoying and tough challenges. For all the achievement hunters out there, they will be a good collection.Solo play is also enjoyable, allowing you to just relax and kill zombies at your own pace.Steam approved sites and other third party websites have skins, maps, sounds and other mods that are perfectly fine and legal to use whenever you feel bored with the original game. Just stay away from the hacks, no one likes a dirty hacker.Personal Rating: 4/5

												The game itself is addicting and terrific. The gamer community that plays it however, sucks as human beings. Very noob-unfriendly, and you can expect your angry teammates to either kill you, kick you within 5 minutes, or both. Or ridicule you and laugh as they watch you die, rather than come revive you. Seems to be about 70-80% of the players are a-holes, and take winning far too seriously. You do meet the occasional player who's actually fun to play with. Frankly, everyone pays to play. It sucks for noobs who are constantly kicked as it makes it harder for them to actually improve. Especially, because there are many times that there might only be one room in versus mode. That means if you get kicked from that lobby, you're SOL on getting anymore time in for a while.

content:
Posted: September 6, 2014
												To put it in one sentence, L4D is a challenging FPS with great replayability and one of the best co-ops there are. Pros:-Clean graphics, smooth gameplay experience-Challenging AI-Co-op which really feels like co-op - acting as a team is crucial for completing the campaigns-Good replayability, each session is different even on the same map-Although there are only five kinds of enemies, they are dressed according to the environment, thus complementing the gameplay-Available add-on maps from the communityCons:-It's possible only to equip two weapons at the same time (option 1: a pistol/two pistols with infinite ammo; option 2: sniper rifle, assault rifle, shotgun, military shotgun or machine pistol with limited ammo)-Too often there are situations when zombies catch you by surprise (especially, smokers and hunters) - but's maybe it's just me being a noob-In order to have a better aim, you need to crouch and that's inconvenient-Friendly fire is a mandatory optionMy overall rating: 8/10

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 23, 2014
												► Game: Left 4 Dead► Genre: FPS, Action, Zombie-Apocalypse► Rating: ■ ■ ■ ■ ■ 5/5▲ Favorable Aspecps:After watching, in the past 6 years, all that "boom" of Zombie themed games, specially those where you blow they head off, I can easily assure you that Left 4 Dead, launched in 2008, was one of the biggest responsible for that exponential growth, if not the main responsible. The zombie theme wasn't new at the time, but it never had a solid oportunity at the gaming world, much less in a FPS game. Valve used their best at the time to create this game, and what is it that Valve can't create and automatically become a classic?Well, they did an excelent work again in this title, put extremely easy and soft controls, gave us hordes of zombies to kill, not only weak and rotten zombies, but special ones, with specific abilities, which guarantees different gamestyle, when you're trying to avoid them. Every character has it's own personality, line of words, thinking, and are at some point even funny to hear. For some, that may break some of the tension that the game can produce.Other huge step in the making of this game is the addition of the Cooperative mode, which is undeniable required to survive. Any effort will be useless if you don't have on your side some good mates to release you when get caught by some nasty infected, for example. There are also some other game modes like Versus (player vs player) and Survival (player vs time).Left 4 Dead is that kind of classic that can be played at any time, by any generation, and will always bring you that same joy and fun that you had when you played it by the first time. A real masterpiece. Without a doubt.▼ Negative Aspects: After giving that huge statement in favor of Left 4 Dead, it is hard to point out some minor imperfections, but they always exist. There are two things that I believe they could take better care on this game: the lack of weapons, by that I mean variety, there aren't many different guns to kill, specially melee. And the second is that they didn't launch a lot of official campaigns, or maps. Fortunately, L4D2 came out just one year later.► How much is it worth to pay: [●] Full Price [ ] 75% [ ] 50% or Less

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 29, 2016
												Is it worth buying Left 4 dead or should you just buy Left 4 dead 2?Well, it all depends on what kind of person you are, and your personal preference.Know that Left 4 dead 2 has all of the maps that Left 4 dead has, as well as all its new maps. Left 4 dead 2's multiplayer is infinitely more active than 1, but that's not to say 1's online is dead.Although the old maps are in 2, the new zombies and weapons will also appear. This is a bit of an immersion-breaker for me, because those zombies weren't supposed to exist until L4D2. Playing with four weapon types and no melee weapons is a completely different experience than L4D2, and although I love the new weapons introduced in L4D2, especially the melee weapons, I think I actually prefer how the game feels with the streamlined weapon selection.L4D2 has access to the workshop, but 1 has plenty more mods that you can access online. There are plenty of quality fan-made campaigns out there to download.If you're thinking of buying both, I highly recommend buying both.If you're going to buy one, buy L4D2.

content:
Posted: August 14, 2016
												Left 4 Dead. The real ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ when it comes to zombie shooters. This was a fantastic game at the time, but since the release of Left 4 Dead 2, there is not much reason to buy this game. All content that was featured in L4D1 is implemented in L4D2. However, L4D1 does feature a slightly *darker* atmosphere and horror. When you look down you actually see your feet, and admittedly the L4D1 survivors featured in L4D2 have slightly buggy animations. All in all, if you want the authentic Left 4 Dead 1 experience, I will recommend this game. Before the release of L4D2, I would highly recommend this game. There's not much reason to get this game.

content:
Posted: February 2, 2016
Versus OnlyIf you're new and play versus, you will most likely get kicked 90% of your games.Great game, Good memories. Nowadays it may be dead but when it was in full stride it was one of the best games you could ever play. From a experienced player who has been playing since 2009, its really competitive and fun at the same time. This game is mostly dependant on teamwork but if you are good enough to skeet hunters, spot smokers before they pull you and know how to avoid tank attacks then hey, do your thing, run your♥♥♥♥♥to the saferoom and watch porn or take a smoke break until your team manages to get there. If you are good enough to do that but still want to cooperate with your team to win together then that makes you a even better player. Better to die together then be caught by hunters all alone thinking to yourself how you should of avoided it then ragequit blaming your team. All in all, This game is really good if you have a group of friends willing to play with you if you are new, if you are somewhat experienced. go ahead and spend 10 hours looking for a game\lobby and kick some♥♥♥♥♥ i know there are lot of good players out there who still play.Pros +Good competitive games.Easy to learn.Chill players.Fun with friends.Good game if you want to kill time.Cons -Games can be too competitive if you stumble upon certain players.Hard to master.Alot of toxic\rage players.Can be boring without friends unless you talk ingame.Will ruin your life if you play too much.Most players judge you by how many hours you've played.Barely anyone plays anymore.Stay positive, have fun and dont forget! Always attack as a team, the feeling of getting a quad is awesome :D

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 17, 2016
												Having played l4d2 for four years, i did not actually play the original Left 4 Dead game but i'm glad i did. This game defintely has a different feel than Left 4 Dead 2. Here are some notable differences i have noticed playing Left 4 Dead:- 2 Tanks can spawn in one chapter (This is unlike Left 4 Dead 2 where only 1 Tank is allowed to spawn on non-finale chapters)- It is much easier to startle a Witch in Left 4 Dead as compared to Witches in Left 4 Dead 2.- You can friendly fire your teammates with pistols while your incapped (This is absent in Left 4 Dead 2)- If you fully discharge your shotgun you will perform an additional pumping action before you can shoot again.- It feels like Hunters attempt to sneak up to you more often as compared to Left 4 Dead 2.- Ai Bots can shoot car alarms, gas cans, propane tanks and oxygen tanks.The question many people wonder is if they should get Left 4 Dead since Left 4 Dead 2 has such a large fanbase with the workshop. If your looking to grasp the feel of the original game i would say go for Left 4 Dead, but because of how little people play i would advise buying this game only on sale. Left 4 Dead 2 is still the better game but defintely did not regret checking out the original feel of the game.

content:
Posted: February 28, 2015
												To me this game is pretty good and here is why.But as I always say these are my thoughts you can have your own but these are mine.The goodsFour playable characters such as Bill/Francis/Louis/and Zoey (Not a big fan of zoey for my own reasons.)A pretty good amount of levels to play around in.The game does take team work.Three game modes to play such as Campaign (The Storyish Mode.) survival fighting a never ending amount of zombies and alike and vs where you vs players in human vs special infected matchs.I do like how they made the levels also.Can see your own legs (Opionion)Ragdoll deaths for survivors (Opionion)People made custom Campaigns. (will also be a part of this in the bads area.)The badsNot as many players as Left 4 Dead 2May have levels created by other people but does not have steam workshop. So you will have to do more work going on sites and downloading levels and placeing them in the right spot. (Yep i said there would be a part to that one up there that was going to be in the bads.)Now and again on expert you will get a random person who joins and kills the whole team for fun. Or even worse kills them all when the rescue arrives at the end of a campaign and then wins by them selfs and quitsSome times have to use to much team work and every one else may want to try to be a super soldier and fight on there own.hit box can be a little off at times but not the worse.The Vote Kick System can be awful not because of the system it self, But thing is based on how people act. In other words people who say vote kick is the answer to every thing will abuse it.What Left 4 Dead has That Left 4 Dead 2 does notIts own survival mode levels While Left 4 dead 2 has two of no mercys and all of the sacrafices survival levels the rest of the Left 4 Deads survival Levels are only in Left 4 DeadCan see your own characters legsRagdoll deaths For SurvivorsTanks were less nice if they knocked you down most of the time they would beat you to death rather then go for the others. Meaning that most of the time you would have three and not four people now. Also tank ran faster on fire so burning him would mean he can run faster then you now.All the weapons and special infected have different stats.OverallI say give it a try if you have friends to play with because all the campaigns from Left 4 Dead made it into Left 4 Dead 2. But you will not have the stuff that was only in Left 4 Dead and the level lay outs are a little Different for these levels in Left 4 Dead 2 but keep in mind you only get all of the survival maps from Left 4 Dead if you own Left 4 Dead While in Left 4 Dead 2 you still get two of No Mercys and all the Sacrafice ones from Left 4 Dead. What i am trying to say mostly get Left 4 Dead if you have a few friends who will play it you want to see how Left 4 Dead was compaired to Left 4 Dead 2 or you Like Survival Mode.

content:
Posted: June 15, 2015
												This game is definitely one of my top favorite games, I've been playing this game ever since it has come out and it never gets old in my opinion, because of all the stuff to do. sure you can play single player or play campaign with others online, but also you can do versus, where you are the special infected trying to kill other online survivors, or vice versa. Another great thing about left 4 dead if the originality and unique types of zombies there are, this is not just your typical zombie game, you will be watching out everywhere for dreaded hunters, who jump very far just to tackle you and rip at you with their sharp fingers, Smokers, Who will constrict you with their tongue and hold you as you get hit by other zombies or as it claws at you. and boomers, who puke bile, attracting the common infected horde to attack you while you can barely see anything. And don't forget the witch, the scary thing is that your first time playing it, you would probably not have guessed she'd do what she did. Then there is the tank, who was once a roid head who is now probably the most feared thing in the game. Point is this is and always will be a classic zombie shooter game and has many thing to do and many ways to do them, and is definitely worth the buy.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2014
												I've always liked this game =w= but I don't wanna sound like a complete nerd who studies this game like a textbook on the last week near an exam but yea, I am. The survivors are Louis, Zoey, Francis and Bill. Francis is a cool, biker dude who hasa funny scream when he gets incapped. Louis is a manager or IT analyst, I forget... but he seems to be the most positive character in the game and my 2nd favorite out of the bunch c:, Zoey, who is a earlier college student who has a knack for zombie and horror genres because of her dad, seems to know what she's doing as she is always the first bot to kill me in Versus! She is my No.1 favorite character because she seems the most relatable out of the four. And last but not least, Bill a Veitnam War veteran with awesome combat skills. He seems to be the most mature out of the group and basically the "Dad." He is my 3rd favorite character cause he is just cool. :o There is also 5 Special Infected to stay away from! The Boomer:The Boomer is a disgustingly mutated human able to vomit stuff that comes from the liver called "bile."If  you get doused in it and a horde of zombies go for whoever came in contact with said "bile".The Hunter:My 1st favorite Special Infected c: but, The Hunter seems to be an agile, young man turned into an animal-like creature fixated on ripping your guts out. I'M SURPRISED HE DOESN'T DO MORE DAMAGE. His main method of attack is to crouch and then jump on Survivors with a loud shriek, then he commences to rip your guts out. Yummy.The Smoker:The Smoker seems to be a tall male, who maybe smoked a lot? Well, whatever, he ensares Survivors with his long tounge. His main tounge, this dude has like 7 tongues he doesn't use. lol. Upon attack, the Survivor caught will try to fight away the tongue but fail horribly resulting in one of your teammates to knock the tounge or kill the Smoker itself. I don't want a zombies tongue around me :<The Tank:The Tank is a huge, muscular zombie who's music is over-the-top dramatic. He throws debris and knocks the crap out of Survivors in his way. Better stock up on molotovs for this big jerk c:The Witch:I don't like killing this infected mainly cause she cries. I'm a coward k. The Witch can usually be ignored out in the open and she is known for her cry. Reason she is crying is still sorta unknown but I'm sure it must have been sad. Gunshots pointed at her, flashlights in her face, and people standing too close can♥♥♥♥♥♥her off and she goes into a rage slashing the hell out of any Survivor who harassed her. On rare occassions she can be in a tight, hallway and needed to be killed. I dislike doing it myself since I usually suck at strategy and timing so I ask the nearest friend to do it for us. Make sure those nails don't come in contact with you.Conclusion:Left 4 Dead may not be as interesting as it's sequel Left 4 Dead 2, which retains all the survivors from L4D and all the same Infected and Special Infected. I recommend anyone who doesn't already have this game to get it. And people do still play so yea. Happy Thanksgiving and Happy zombie killing! :)

content:
Posted: January 15, 2014
												You and some friend(s) vs thousands of zombies. They're gonna need more zombies! Grab a pistol or two, and a shotgun or automatic weapon. Kill zombies. That's it. Pick up some health or ammo along the way as you make it from safehouse to safehouse to, hopefully, rescue. There's next to no plot, and if you play on "easy" and don't care for achievements, people can drop in and have a fun romp without any prior knowledge of the game or thought of strategy. Can be played in a variety of co-op modes with 1-4 players (the remaining characters will be led by AI), or Versus modes with 2 teams of 4. The survivors while distinct characters in dress and recorded lines all have the same skillset, while the zombies (who are the opposing team in Versus) are specialists.Pros: Good voice acting; great number of recorded lines. Fun brainless (haha, brains) shooter. Levels tend to be linear, gear limited, and operation straight forward. Go-to game for playing with people who don't play much, or who you don't have many games in common with (as it's often cheap, and there isn't much to learn, you can just get going -- you may wish to get L4D2 instead though). Can in theory be played alone (to survey the "lay of the land" before playing online) -- the AI is competent enough for that.Cons: If you're in the above situation, fine. Otherwise, the game can feel a bit basic (especially compared to other zombie-related titles). Many achievements are extremely hard to gain in single player as the AI players will mess it up by not being in on your private plan, or just generally being too slow. Being swarmed by hordes can get a bit old, especially by fast zombies (says Zoey in the game, "I'm calling zombie ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t on that!") that are in fact so fast that they can overtake you and block your path -- as if it weren't enough that them hitting you while you're running away from them also stops you.Much as I enjoyed the game in its day, I've moved on to more recent titles, except in the "drop-in game to play with people who can't or won't put in a lot of time to gain expertise first" case. Before writing this review, I've revisited the game after a very long pause to gain some achievements I wanted, and after a few days I feel seriously L4D'd out. I might leave L4D2 on disk in case of an impromptu casual romp with some friends, but don't expect to come back otherwise. Greener pastures.Recommendation: Review your use case carefully; don't buy for single player experience or story. Compare carefully against Left 4 Dead 2. Wait for sale, or pick it up on the rare days when it's free.

content:
Posted: July 7, 2011
												Man, I think I've played this game daily for over 6 months, maybe even more. It's so awesome, I think it's better than L4D2, and that's mainly because of the atmosphere. They kinda ruined that in 2, so I really hope they'll revert back to the creepy atmosphere in L4D3. The fact that the AI Director changes things on-the-fly adds lots and lots of replayabilty. There was just so much to do; the achievements were definitely a part of the challenge. Getting medals was also quite fun and challenging.And after we finished the entire game as survivors, we tried the Versus game, just for fun. And guess what ? It was just as much fun as playing survivors, sometimes even better. Ah, good times :D No... scrap that, great times ! :DI have so much love for this game ♥ Buy it, play it, love it !! Love it !!![Rating: 94/100]

content:
Posted: November 19, 2010
												Say bye to your sanity in this game. Unless you like bots, you can play with friends and that's forging bonds.  And because the soundtrack is great (as in L4D). And because Zoey.... well, Zoey is a strong girl you love to protect and to play.Left 4 Dead is a co-op game where you and three friends will have to survive hordes of infected people. You can be Bill, the old veteran, Francis, the biker, Louis, the IT guy and Zoey, the student girl. You can also play alone while the rest of the teams are bots. You will have to survive infected people but also special ones like the Smoker that can grab you with its tongue, the Hunter, that jumps on you, the Boomer, that vomits on you, making you attract infected, the Tank, the big bad boy that is hard to kill or the Witch, that you shouldn't disturb if you don't want to be on the ground.Indeed, the game allows you to be incapacited for a few seconds. People have to help you else you're dead. And you'll respawn in a closet further in the game. Also, you can be healed as there are health packs. You can also boost it thanks to the famous pills. You have few weapons (sniper rifle, shotgun, rifle and pistols) but you can also push the enemies back if needed. You have also pipe bombs and molotov cocktails.The infected are mainly attracted by loud sounds, so you bet that when you have to activate generators or move bridges or anything else, you'll have an horde on you. Generally, this is a moment where you have to battle until you can escape. The end of a campaign is generally the biggest fight. But the best is the AI director that will change the experience each time: if you're doing well, expect more difficulties, if you're not, less enemies will be there for example.You have initially four campaigns. Since then, there are two campaigns that were added: one called Crash Course, with 2 levels only but they're kinda long and another called the Sacrifice, that was tied to Left 4 Dead 2.You have also a versus mode where you're against a human team: at each turn, one will be special infected and the others the survivors's team. So you can be a Boomer, Smoker, Hunter or even a Tank! The goal is to prevent the survivors reaching the safehouse while as survivors, well, it's to reach safety.The graphics are quite good and the soundtrack is excellent.Left 4 Dead is an excellent FPS, single or co-op game. Humor is there, the adrenaline is there and given the different difficulties, it's for novices like hardcore gamers.

content:
Posted: July 16, 2012
												A very simple plot; you start at point A, you have to get to point B alive! Takes a few minutes to learn, and hundreds of hours to master! It is a beautifully executed piece of software, but it does have weaknesses; There are a relatively small number of maps, a very limited number of gun types, and no secrets or surprises, and no bosses!!! It's the same zombies just about every level. Despite that, it is still a superb game, and in my opinion far better than the sequel; L4D2, which is more intense. One of the nice things about L4D is that it gives you time to chat to your friends. L4D2 you have to concentrate all the time. Solo play is OK, but the game comes in to it's own in coop mode. On the higher difficulties, the game demands team-play. In fact most failures are simply because people aren't working as a team. Random people aren't so good at this, and if you want to play on expert it really helps if you have a few people you know!

content:
Posted: March 22, 2014
												Left 4 Dead 1 & 2 ReviewsBoth of the Left 4 Dead games are great examples of what the zombie survival genre is like. Two of the greatest zombie games created. Although some time has passed since their original release dates, Left 4 Dead (2008) and Left 4 Dead 2 (2009), they are both high quality survival games. One flaw with both games is the sheer repetitiveness. There are several different campaigns in both games, but in Left 4 Dead, the outcome always seems the same: Wait for someone to rescue you. Although Left 4 Dead 2 has more to do, it always seems the same. However you can find yourself playing the campaigns several times, playing survival mode countless hours and killing thousands of zombies as soon as you pick up a copy. Since they were made nearly five and six years ago, the graphics are no longer considered high quality, but are in no way an eye-sore. Both Left 4 Dead 1 and 2 have a great replay value, and are easy to learn, making them fun and exciting games. Both games feature four players whether it is offline or online with a common goal in mind. Keep moving, kill everything that moves, and get to the next safehouse or escape route. The weapons are fairly simple, in Left 4 Dead there are assault rifles, snipers, shotguns, pistols and submachine guns, whereas Left 4 Dead 2 has all the same, plus a variety of melee weapons. The stories of both games are fairly simple but overlooked, you will find yourself being more interested in killing hordes of zombies rather than who is on their way to save you.Personally I would like a third game to be made, just like every other L4D fan, including fellow editor Wilson2234 who has logged in more than 22 hundred hours into these games on Steam. I myself have played both versions on Xbox 360 and PC and have to say they run well on both and are a great purchase on either system. Perfect game to play with friends to either waste some time, or play on Expert and strategize how to make it out alive. Overall Left 4 Dead 1 & 2 are two of the greatest survival games on the market. My Rating 8/10Billy Benoit of GamesUnlimited Reviews Visual Rating: 7/10 Audio Rating: 8.5/10 Story Rating: 7/10Playability Rating: 9/10 Replay Value: 8/10 Multiplayer: 8.5/10Please check out some of our other reviews at {LINK REMOVED}http://gamesunlimitedreviews.webs.com Thanks for reading!

content:
Posted: May 15, 2014
												It all started when our protagonist, Civ 5, woke up in a pumpkin patch. It was the fourth time it had happened. Feeling ridiculously exasperated, Civ 5 groped a sock, thinking it would make him feel better (but as usual, it did not). Unexpectedly, he realized that his beloved ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth was missing! Immediately he called his friend, Leroy Jenkins. Civ 5 had known Leroy Jenkins for (plus or minus) one million years, the majority of which were sassy ones. Leroy Jenkins was unique. He was intelligent though sometimes a little... dimwitted. Civ 5 called him anyway, for the situation was urgent.Leroy Jenkins picked up to a very happy Civ 5. Leroy Jenkins calmly assured him that most koalas yawn before mating, yet otters usually earnestly grimace *after* mating. He had no idea what that meant; he was only concerned with distracting Civ 5. Why was Leroy Jenkins trying to distract Civ 5? Because he had snuck out from Civ 5's with the ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth only four days prior. It was a saucy little ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth... how could he resist?It didn't take long before Civ 5 got back to the subject at hand: his ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth. Leroy Jenkins sighed. Relunctantly, Leroy Jenkins invited him over, assuring him they'd find the ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth. Civ 5 grabbed his desk and disembarked immediately. After hanging up the phone, Leroy Jenkins realized that he was in trouble. He had to find a place to hide the ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth and he had to do it thoughtfully. He figured that if Civ 5 took the truck, he had take at least eleven minutes before Civ 5 would get there. But if he took the ♥♥♥? Then Leroy Jenkins would be alarmingly screwed.Before he could come up with any reasonable ideas, Leroy Jenkins was interrupted by seven abrasive aligators that were lured by his ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth. Leroy Jenkins sighed; 'Not again', he thought. Feeling frustrated, he thoughtfully reached for his mitten and aptly backhanded every last one of them. Apparently this was an adequate deterrent--the discouraged critters began to scurry back toward the thicket, squealing with discontent. He exhaled with relief. That's when he heard the ♥♥♥ rolling up. It was Civ 5.----o0o---- As he pulled up, he felt a sense of urgency. He had had to make an unscheduled stop at Wal-Mart to pick up a 12-pack of pencils, so he knew he was running late. With a calculated leap, Civ 5 was out of the ♥♥♥ and went indiscriminately jaunting toward Leroy Jenkins's front door. Meanwhile inside, Leroy Jenkins was panicking. Not thinking, he tossed the ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth into a box of mittens and then slid the box behind his piano. Leroy Jenkins was concerned but at least the ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth was concealed. The doorbell rang.'Come in,' Leroy Jenkins sassily purred. With a careful push, Civ 5 opened the door. 'Sorry for being late, but I was being chased by some funny-smelling maniac in a Vette,' he lied. 'It's fine,' Leroy Jenkins assured him. Civ 5 took a seat vaguely close to where Leroy Jenkins had hidden the ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth. Leroy Jenkins cringed trying unsuccessfully to hide his nervousness. 'Uhh, can I get you anything?' he blurted. But Civ 5 was distracted. Without warning, Leroy Jenkins noticed a selfish look on Civ 5's face. Civ 5 slowly opened his mouth to speak.'...What's that smell?'Leroy Jenkins felt a stabbing pain in his butt when Civ 5 asked this. In a moment of disbelief, he realized that he had hidden the ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth right by his oscillating fan. 'Wh-what? I don't smell anything..!' A lie. A insensitive look started to form on Civ 5's face. He turned to notice a box that seemed clearly out of place. 'Th-th-those are just my grandma's mittens from when she used to have pet bunnies. She, uh...dropped 'em by here earlier'. Civ 5 nodded with fake acknowledgement...then, before Leroy Jenkins could react, Civ 5 randomly lunged toward the box and opened it. The ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth was plainly in view.Civ 5 stared at Leroy Jenkins for what what must've been four seconds. Unexpectedly, Leroy Jenkins groped wildly in Civ 5's direction, clearly desperate. Civ 5 grabbed the ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth and bolted for the door. It was locked. Leroy Jenkins let out a eccentric chuckle. 'If only you hadn't been so protective of that thing, none of this would have happened, Civ 5,' he rebuked. Leroy Jenkins always had been a little insensitive, so Civ 5 knew that reconciliation was not an option; he needed to escape before Leroy Jenkins did something crazy, like... start chucking mittens at him or something. All of a sudden, he gripped his ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth tightly and made a dash toward the window, diving headlong through the glass panels.Leroy Jenkins looked on, blankly. 'What the hell? That seemed excessive. The other door was open, you know.' Silence from Civ 5. 'And to think, I varnished that window frame nine days ago...it never ends!' Suddenly he felt a tinge of concern for Civ 5. 'Oh. You ..okay?' Still silence. Leroy Jenkins walked over to the window and looked down. Civ 5 was gone.----o0o---- Just yonder, Civ 5 was struggling to make his way through the pumpkin patch behind Leroy Jenkins's place. Civ 5 had severely hurt his arm during the window incident, and was starting to lose strength. Another pack of feral aligators suddenly appeared, having caught wind of the ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth. One by one they latched on to Civ 5. Already weakened from his injury, Civ 5 yielded to the furry onslaught and collapsed. The last thing he saw before losing consciousness was a buzzing horde of aligators running off with his ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth.About seven hours later, Civ 5 awoke, his butt throbbing. It was dark and Civ 5 did not know where he was. Deep in the humid desert, Civ 5 was abundantly lost. A few minutes later, he remembered that his ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth was taken by the aligators. But at that point, he was just thankful for his life. That's when, to his horror, a oversized aligator emerged from the cornfield. It was the alpha aligator. Civ 5 opened his mouth to scream but was cut short when the aligator sunk its teeth into Civ 5's face. With a faint groan, the life escaped from Civ 5's lungs, but not before he realized that he was a failure.Less than two miles away, Leroy Jenkins was entombed by anguish over the loss of the ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth. 'MY PRECIOUS!!' he cried, as he reached for a sharpened spoon. With a heroic thrust, he buried it deeply into his neck. As the room began to fade to black, he thought about Civ 5... wishing he had found the courage to tell him that he loved him. But he would die alone that day. All that remained was the ♥♥♥♥♥ of truth that had turned them against each other, ultimately causing their demise. And as the dew on melancholy sappling branches began to reflect the dawn's reddish glare, all that could be heard was the chilling cry of distant aligators, desecrating all things sacred to virtuous men, and perpetuating an evil that would reign for centuries to come. Our heroes would've lived unhappily ever after, but they were too busy being dead. So, no one lived forever after, the end. :'(

content:
Posted: April 19, 2011
												An original co-op zombie game. Fight the zombies or be a zombie. This is the first game that really makes you rely on teammates for assistance. Most players have moved on to L4D2, which certainly adds a lot of variety to the game, but L4D2 still feels incomplete and lacking in many ways. See my L4D2 review for more details. If you're trying to decide between L4D and L4D2, go with L4D.*Update: although I believe L4D1 is better than L4D2. At this point in time L4D1 is pretty much dead. Most servers are empty. Versus is almost always empty. If you can find players for L4D versus most of them brazingly cheat, act like aѕѕhоles, grief and/or crash the server via ddos or an exploit when the game doesn't go in their favor. I personally contacted Valve two times about patching vulnerbilities in their vanilla servers to prevent ddos. I believe the exploit that can cause a server to crash can also be patched. Valve has ignored my pleas. By the looks of it Valve has abondoned all support for this game.I remember when L4D versus gaming was a fun, rewarding socializing experience. Now its just full of bullying, rude and unfriendly behavior.

Posted: November 23, 2014
												This game started the whole craze over Left 4 Dead series. It's bare bones when compared to it's sequel: Few guns, no uncommons, not as many special infected. But, it is a start, and that's what matters. Co-op or solo, it's a nice game. What alot of people take to is the VS and Survival gameplays, which can be quite brutal on one's confidence. But, it's a nice early nostalgic feel when going back to it from L4D2, thus, it gets a 3/5.

Posted: May 21, 2016
												This is an amazing game,Sure L4D2 has this within it and morebut when I play this its not just,"Oh the second game has it, screw this one."no I play it because I get a nostalgic feel when I play it,its satisfactory and it has more of an eerie creepier feel more than the second one,the second felt like a loud bloodbash,this one is a quiet SCARE THE CRAP OUT OF YOU kind of feel and its great,its basic and I reccomend it to anyone.I remember playing back when I was younger around 2009 and it was what I was used to,even though the second one has this within it and more (yes I know I'm repeating) It just has sentimental and nostalgic value that you can't beat any other way.I do have a fare warning,if you didn't grow up with this one first and have no feel towards the nostalga I wouldn't reccommend it,if thats how you feel about it,(no nostalga) then just get the second one and have fun with mods and stuff.Also,if you feel that way about that,this would be that kind of game where you have nothing left to buy and just say, "screw it" and you buy this,just to have in your library,who knows? maybe one of your friends has this one and not the second one because he bought this when it came out,now you can play with that friend,(if he doesnt already have the second one) BUT HAVE FUAN AND ENJOY LADDIES

content:
Posted: January 27, 2011
												Once an awesome multi experience from Valve is now but a shell, with practically no fan base left. Fun if you have friends for the campaigns, but mainly, the Versus is where the honey was to be found in this game. Unfortunately Left 4 Dead 2 diluted the fan base between the two games and it's never been the same since.If you can round up 8 people for a versus game, it's worth buying when cheap. But if not, avoid. Without the multiplayer, this once fun game is a shadow of its former self. Sad, but true.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 19, 2011
												An original co-op zombie game. Fight the zombies or be a zombie. This is the first game that really makes you rely on teammates for assistance. Most players have moved on to L4D2, which certainly adds a lot of variety to the game, but L4D2 still feels incomplete and lacking in many ways. See my L4D2 review for more details. If you're trying to decide between L4D and L4D2, go with L4D.*Update: although I believe L4D1 is better than L4D2. At this point in time L4D1 is pretty much dead. Most servers are empty. Versus is almost always empty. If you can find players for L4D versus most of them brazingly cheat, act like aѕѕhоles, grief and/or crash the server via ddos or an exploit when the game doesn't go in their favor. I personally contacted Valve two times about patching vulnerbilities in their vanilla servers to prevent ddos. I believe the exploit that can cause a server to crash can also be patched. Valve has ignored my pleas. By the looks of it Valve has abondoned all support for this game.I remember when L4D versus gaming was a fun, rewarding socializing experience. Now its just full of bullying, rude and unfriendly behavior.

content:
Posted: September 18, 2016
												Left 4 Dead 1 is one less than Left 4 Dead 2, but despite that is still an ace game.There was a lot of stuff added in the second game, but the formula was already perfect. And that's not to say the sequel is bad, it's not, both of them are fantastic games.Still, I don't know if it's worth buying the first game anymore. There's a 'Left 4 Dead 1 coop' mutation for L4D2 that literally just makes the game play just like the first one. On top of this, all of the campaigns have been officially ported over by Valve themselves, so... I guess if you REALLY BADLY want that PURITY of Left 4 Dead 1, you might consider buying this, but otherwise just grab the second game.That said, they changed some things with weapons around in the second game, most notably I don't think you actually have to count your shotgun rounds off if you're using the XM1014, because the reload is always the same speed. And the addition of 'more guns' is nice, but again, you only need the five or so weapons that L4D1 offers. You have your M16, your XM1014, Uzi, pump shotgun. That's really all you need. Anything more just 'bloats' the game, in a way.Sometimes, less is more.Either way, I can't possibly not recommend this game, because, come on, it's Left 4 Dead, the sceond game releasing didn't MAGICALLY warp time and space and cause the first game to be bad.

content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
												Ahhh yes the first true Action/Survival Horror zombie game that was worth a crap. Not to mention one of the VERY few co-op games to grace the genre at the time. I remember the many hours myself and many of my friends spent playing this thing and then staying up all night talking about the "Zombie Apocalypse" and planning our next run through of the game only with higher difficulty. Never did beat all the levels on expert but needless to say i purchased it again for pc even after L4D2 was released (a sale came up shortly thereafter and i got L4D2. thus so few hours.). I always loved the original story more than the second.However even with all the wonderful moments this game has brought too me i simply cannot reccomend anyone purchase this game. Reason being that they have added the first story and all dlc plus steam workshop integration all into L4D2.. So obviously it is not that this game isnt any good or that i did'nt like it. Whybuy it if you can get everything and then some through a better, cheaper alternative(an upgrade really).

content:
Posted: July 13, 2016
												RU Скажу честно, я играл сначала в неё принуждённо! Был 2015 год, я восстановил стим и вспомнил что купил the orange box, я закачал эту игру из-за того что 2 часть не шла (из-за ошибки с файлами).Я этого не жалею! Первое ощущение что ты реально в центре событий игра: очень сильная атмосфера(я очень испугался когда увидел ведьму), красивая(на 8 год) графика и конечно же ощущение того что тебя прикроют напарники дает уверенности. Если вы хотите купить эту игру, то она это заслуживает.Плюсы:+Атмосфера+Хорошая графика+Отличные компании+Возможность загрузки доп. контента+Неплохие напарники+Хороший ИИ+В игра есть Режиссёр(ИИ) он расставляет вещи и зараженных в зависимости от игры, можно перепроходить ходить компании бесконечно.+Особые заражённыеМинусы: -Если вы играете на эксперте, то нубы (обычно они имеют ники пиратов: by Pioneer,I am noob, noob_(И двухзначное число любое), noSTEAM.ro) начинают мешать( френдли фаер, тим килл и т.д.)-Игра уже старая поэтому в неё уже меньше играют(но всё равно игроков много).Итого: эта игра заслуживает чтобы её купить(не пиратить!!!)! Уверен, она надолго останется в ваших сердцах( она лучше 2 части).Спасибо за внимание!EU To be honest, I played it compulsively! Was 2015, I repaired steam and remembered that I bought the orange box, I've downloaded this game due to the fact that part 2 was not (because of an error with the files).I do not regret it! The first impression that you're really in the center of events the game a very strong atmosphere(I was very scared when I saw the witch), beautiful(8 year) graphics and of course the feeling that your back gives teammates confidence. If you want to buy this game, it deserves it.Pros:+Atmosphere+Good graphics+Great company+The ability to download additional content+Good companions+Good AI+The game has a Directed(s) he puts belongings and infected, depending on the game, you can replay go to the company indefinitely.+Special infectedCons: -If you play on expert, then noobs (they usually have nicknames pirate by Pioneer,I am a noob, noob_(And any two-digit number), noSTEAM.ro) get in the way( friendly fire, team kill, etc.)-The game is old, so it has less play(but still a lot of players).Total: this game deserves to buy it(not pirate!!!)! I'm sure it will long remain in your hearts( it is better than the 2 parts).Thank you for your attention!
